module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup

-- | Detailed information about a subnet group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBSubnetGroup</a> smart constructor.
data DBSubnetGroup
DBSubnetGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Subnet] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DBSubnetGroup

-- | The name of the subnet group.
[$sel:dbSubnetGroupName:DBSubnetGroup'] :: DBSubnetGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the virtual private cloud (VPC) ID of the subnet group.
[$sel:vpcId:DBSubnetGroup'] :: DBSubnetGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about one or more subnets within a subnet group.
[$sel:subnets:DBSubnetGroup'] :: DBSubnetGroup -> Maybe [Subnet]

-- | Provides the description of the subnet group.
[$sel:dbSubnetGroupDescription:DBSubnetGroup'] :: DBSubnetGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB subnet group.
[$sel:dbSubnetGroupArn:DBSubnetGroup'] :: DBSubnetGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the status of the subnet group.
[$sel:subnetGroupStatus:DBSubnetGroup'] :: DBSubnetGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DBSubnetGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroupName:DBSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupName</a> - The name of the subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:DBSubnetGroup'</a>, <a>dbSubnetGroup_vpcId</a> -
--   Provides the virtual private cloud (VPC) ID of the subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnets:DBSubnetGroup'</a>, <a>dbSubnetGroup_subnets</a> -
--   Detailed information about one or more subnets within a subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroupDescription:DBSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupDescription</a> - Provides the
--   description of the subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroupArn:DBSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   for the DB subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetGroupStatus:DBSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>dbSubnetGroup_subnetGroupStatus</a> - Provides the status of the
--   subnet group.
newDBSubnetGroup :: DBSubnetGroup

-- | The name of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupName :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the virtual private cloud (VPC) ID of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_vpcId :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about one or more subnets within a subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_subnets :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe [Subnet])

-- | Provides the description of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupDescription :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupArn :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the status of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_subnetGroupStatus :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup.DBSubnetGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup.DBSubnetGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup.DBSubnetGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup.DBSubnetGroup
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup.DBSubnetGroup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup.DBSubnetGroup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBSubnetGroup.DBSubnetGroup


module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag

-- | Metadata assigned to an Amazon DocumentDB resource consisting of a
--   key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with
--   "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>". The string can contain only the
--   set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+',
--   '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with
--   "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>". The string can contain only the
--   set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+',
--   '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The optional value of the
--   tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in
--   length and can't be prefixed with "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>".
--   The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white
--   space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex:
--   "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The required name of the tag.
--   The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and
--   can't be prefixed with "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>". The string
--   can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_',
--   '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex:
--   "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
newTag :: Tag

-- | The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with
--   "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>". The string can contain only the
--   set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+',
--   '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with
--   "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>". The string can contain only the
--   set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+',
--   '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget

-- | The version of the database engine that an instance can be upgraded
--   to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpgradeTarget</a> smart constructor.
data UpgradeTarget
UpgradeTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> UpgradeTarget

-- | The version number of the upgrade target database engine.
[$sel:engineVersion:UpgradeTarget'] :: UpgradeTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates whether a database engine is upgraded to a
--   major version.
[$sel:isMajorVersionUpgrade:UpgradeTarget'] :: UpgradeTarget -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the upgrade target database engine.
[$sel:engine:UpgradeTarget'] :: UpgradeTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates whether the target version is applied to any
--   source DB instances that have <tt>AutoMinorVersionUpgrade</tt> set to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:autoUpgrade:UpgradeTarget'] :: UpgradeTarget -> Maybe Bool

-- | The version of the database engine that an instance can be upgraded
--   to.
[$sel:description:UpgradeTarget'] :: UpgradeTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpgradeTarget</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:UpgradeTarget'</a>,
--   <a>upgradeTarget_engineVersion</a> - The version number of the upgrade
--   target database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMajorVersionUpgrade:UpgradeTarget'</a>,
--   <a>upgradeTarget_isMajorVersionUpgrade</a> - A value that indicates
--   whether a database engine is upgraded to a major version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:UpgradeTarget'</a>, <a>upgradeTarget_engine</a> - The
--   name of the upgrade target database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoUpgrade:UpgradeTarget'</a>,
--   <a>upgradeTarget_autoUpgrade</a> - A value that indicates whether the
--   target version is applied to any source DB instances that have
--   <tt>AutoMinorVersionUpgrade</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpgradeTarget'</a>,
--   <a>upgradeTarget_description</a> - The version of the database engine
--   that an instance can be upgraded to.
newUpgradeTarget :: UpgradeTarget

-- | The version number of the upgrade target database engine.
upgradeTarget_engineVersion :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether a database engine is upgraded to a
--   major version.
upgradeTarget_isMajorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the upgrade target database engine.
upgradeTarget_engine :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether the target version is applied to any
--   source DB instances that have <tt>AutoMinorVersionUpgrade</tt> set to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
upgradeTarget_autoUpgrade :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Bool)

-- | The version of the database engine that an instance can be upgraded
--   to.
upgradeTarget_description :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget.UpgradeTarget
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget.UpgradeTarget
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget.UpgradeTarget
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget.UpgradeTarget
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget.UpgradeTarget
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget.UpgradeTarget
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.UpgradeTarget.UpgradeTarget


module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBEngineVersion

-- | Detailed information about an engine version.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBEngineVersion</a> smart constructor.
data DBEngineVersion
DBEngineVersion' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [UpgradeTarget] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> DBEngineVersion

-- | The version number of the database engine.
[$sel:engineVersion:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the database engine version.
[$sel:dbEngineVersionDescription:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the database engine.
[$sel:engine:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the parameter group family for the database engine.
[$sel:dbParameterGroupFamily:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the database engine.
[$sel:dbEngineDescription:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of engine versions that this database engine version can be
--   upgraded to.
[$sel:validUpgradeTarget:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe [UpgradeTarget]

-- | A value that indicates whether the engine version supports exporting
--   the log types specified by <tt>ExportableLogTypes</tt> to CloudWatch
--   Logs.
[$sel:supportsLogExportsToCloudwatchLogs:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe Bool

-- | The types of logs that the database engine has available for export to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:exportableLogTypes:DBEngineVersion'] :: DBEngineVersion -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>DBEngineVersion</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:DBEngineVersion'</a>,
--   <a>dbEngineVersion_engineVersion</a> - The version number of the
--   database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbEngineVersionDescription:DBEngineVersion'</a>,
--   <a>dbEngineVersion_dbEngineVersionDescription</a> - The description of
--   the database engine version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:DBEngineVersion'</a>, <a>dbEngineVersion_engine</a> -
--   The name of the database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbParameterGroupFamily:DBEngineVersion'</a>,
--   <a>dbEngineVersion_dbParameterGroupFamily</a> - The name of the
--   parameter group family for the database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbEngineDescription:DBEngineVersion'</a>,
--   <a>dbEngineVersion_dbEngineDescription</a> - The description of the
--   database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validUpgradeTarget:DBEngineVersion'</a>,
--   <a>dbEngineVersion_validUpgradeTarget</a> - A list of engine versions
--   that this database engine version can be upgraded to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportsLogExportsToCloudwatchLogs:DBEngineVersion'</a>,
--   <a>dbEngineVersion_supportsLogExportsToCloudwatchLogs</a> - A value
--   that indicates whether the engine version supports exporting the log
--   types specified by <tt>ExportableLogTypes</tt> to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportableLogTypes:DBEngineVersion'</a>,
--   <a>dbEngineVersion_exportableLogTypes</a> - The types of logs that the
--   database engine has available for export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
newDBEngineVersion :: DBEngineVersion

-- | The version number of the database engine.
dbEngineVersion_engineVersion :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the database engine version.
dbEngineVersion_dbEngineVersionDescription :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the database engine.
dbEngineVersion_engine :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the parameter group family for the database engine.
dbEngineVersion_dbParameterGroupFamily :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the database engine.
dbEngineVersion_dbEngineDescription :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of engine versions that this database engine version can be
--   upgraded to.
dbEngineVersion_validUpgradeTarget :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe [UpgradeTarget])

-- | A value that indicates whether the engine version supports exporting
--   the log types specified by <tt>ExportableLogTypes</tt> to CloudWatch
--   Logs.
dbEngineVersion_supportsLogExportsToCloudwatchLogs :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe Bool)

-- | The types of logs that the database engine has available for export to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
dbEngineVersion_exportableLogTypes :: Lens' DBEngineVersion (Maybe [Text])

data VpcSecurityGroupMembership

module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance

-- | Detailed information about an instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBInstance</a> smart constructor.
data DBInstance
DBInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe DBSubnetGroup -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Endpoint -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe [DBInstanceStatusInfo] -> DBInstance

-- | Indicates the database engine version.
[$sel:engineVersion:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether or not the instance is encrypted.
[$sel:storageEncrypted:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | Contains the name of the cluster that the instance is a member of if
--   the instance is a member of a cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Not supported. Amazon DocumentDB does not currently support public
--   endpoints. The value of <tt>PubliclyAccessible</tt> is always
--   <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | Does not apply. This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB.
--   Amazon DocumentDB does not perform minor version upgrades regardless
--   of the value set.
[$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the instance.
[$sel:dbInstanceArn:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the date and time that the instance was created.
[$sel:instanceCreateTime:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this instance.
[$sel:engine:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
[$sel:latestRestorableTime:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Contains the name of the compute and memory capacity class of the
--   instance.
[$sel:dbInstanceClass:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica
--   is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing
--   primary instance.
[$sel:promotionTier:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can
--   occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the CA certificate for this DB instance.
[$sel:cACertificateIdentifier:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains a user-provided database identifier. This identifier is the
--   unique key that identifies an instance.
[$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | If <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier
--   for the encrypted instance.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are
--   created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the
--   <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
[$sel:preferredBackupWindow:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the Availability Zone that the instance is
--   located in.
[$sel:availabilityZone:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides a list of VPC security group elements that the instance
--   belongs to.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership]

-- | Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are
--   retained.
[$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   instance, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
[$sel:dbSubnetGroup:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe DBSubnetGroup

-- | A list of log types that this instance is configured to export to
--   CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:enabledCloudwatchLogsExports:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the instance. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the instance is accessed.
[$sel:dbiResourceId:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the connection endpoint.
[$sel:endpoint:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Endpoint

-- | Specifies the current state of this database.
[$sel:dbInstanceStatus:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies that changes to the instance are pending. This element is
--   included only when changes are pending. Specific changes are
--   identified by subelements.
[$sel:pendingModifiedValues:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe PendingModifiedValues

-- | The status of a read replica. If the instance is not a read replica,
--   this is blank.
[$sel:statusInfos:DBInstance'] :: DBInstance -> Maybe [DBInstanceStatusInfo]

-- | Create a value of <a>DBInstance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_engineVersion</a>
--   - Indicates the database engine version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageEncrypted:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_storageEncrypted</a> - Specifies whether or not the
--   instance is encrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - Contains the name of the
--   cluster that the instance is a member of if the instance is a member
--   of a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publiclyAccessible:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_publiclyAccessible</a> - Not supported. Amazon
--   DocumentDB does not currently support public endpoints. The value of
--   <tt>PubliclyAccessible</tt> is always <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> - Does not apply. This
--   parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB does
--   not perform minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceArn:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_dbInstanceArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCreateTime:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_instanceCreateTime</a> - Provides the date and time that
--   the instance was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_engine</a> - Provides
--   the name of the database engine to be used for this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestRestorableTime:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_latestRestorableTime</a> - Specifies the latest time to
--   which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceClass:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_dbInstanceClass</a> - Contains the name of the compute
--   and memory capacity class of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:promotionTier:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_promotionTier</a>
--   - A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB
--   replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the
--   existing primary instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - Specifies the weekly
--   time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:cACertificateIdentifier:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_cACertificateIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the CA
--   certificate for this DB instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier</a> - Contains a user-provided
--   database identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies
--   an instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_kmsKeyId</a> - If
--   <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier for
--   the encrypted instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_preferredBackupWindow</a> - Specifies the daily time
--   range during which automated backups are created if automated backups
--   are enabled, as determined by the <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_availabilityZone</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   Availability Zone that the instance is located in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_vpcSecurityGroups</a> - Provides a list of VPC security
--   group elements that the instance belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_backupRetentionPeriod</a> - Specifies the number of days
--   for which automatic snapshots are retained.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroup:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_dbSubnetGroup</a>
--   - Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with
--   the instance, including the name, description, and subnets in the
--   subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabledCloudwatchLogsExports:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_enabledCloudwatchLogsExports</a> - A list of log types
--   that this instance is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbiResourceId:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_dbiResourceId</a>
--   - The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the instance. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the instance is accessed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_endpoint</a> -
--   Specifies the connection endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceStatus:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_dbInstanceStatus</a> - Specifies the current state of
--   this database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pendingModifiedValues:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_pendingModifiedValues</a> - Specifies that changes to
--   the instance are pending. This element is included only when changes
--   are pending. Specific changes are identified by subelements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusInfos:DBInstance'</a>, <a>dbInstance_statusInfos</a> -
--   The status of a read replica. If the instance is not a read replica,
--   this is blank.
newDBInstance :: DBInstance

-- | Indicates the database engine version.
dbInstance_engineVersion :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether or not the instance is encrypted.
dbInstance_storageEncrypted :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | Contains the name of the cluster that the instance is a member of if
--   the instance is a member of a cluster.
dbInstance_dbClusterIdentifier :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Not supported. Amazon DocumentDB does not currently support public
--   endpoints. The value of <tt>PubliclyAccessible</tt> is always
--   <tt>false</tt>.
dbInstance_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | Does not apply. This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB.
--   Amazon DocumentDB does not perform minor version upgrades regardless
--   of the value set.
dbInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the instance.
dbInstance_dbInstanceArn :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the date and time that the instance was created.
dbInstance_instanceCreateTime :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this instance.
dbInstance_engine :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
dbInstance_latestRestorableTime :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains the name of the compute and memory capacity class of the
--   instance.
dbInstance_dbInstanceClass :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica
--   is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing
--   primary instance.
dbInstance_promotionTier :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can
--   occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
dbInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the CA certificate for this DB instance.
dbInstance_cACertificateIdentifier :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains a user-provided database identifier. This identifier is the
--   unique key that identifies an instance.
dbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier
--   for the encrypted instance.
dbInstance_kmsKeyId :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are
--   created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the
--   <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
dbInstance_preferredBackupWindow :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the Availability Zone that the instance is
--   located in.
dbInstance_availabilityZone :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides a list of VPC security group elements that the instance
--   belongs to.
dbInstance_vpcSecurityGroups :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership])

-- | Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are
--   retained.
dbInstance_backupRetentionPeriod :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   instance, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
dbInstance_dbSubnetGroup :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe DBSubnetGroup)

-- | A list of log types that this instance is configured to export to
--   CloudWatch Logs.
dbInstance_enabledCloudwatchLogsExports :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the instance. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the instance is accessed.
dbInstance_dbiResourceId :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the connection endpoint.
dbInstance_endpoint :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Endpoint)

-- | Specifies the current state of this database.
dbInstance_dbInstanceStatus :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies that changes to the instance are pending. This element is
--   included only when changes are pending. Specific changes are
--   identified by subelements.
dbInstance_pendingModifiedValues :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe PendingModifiedValues)

-- | The status of a read replica. If the instance is not a read replica,
--   this is blank.
dbInstance_statusInfos :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe [DBInstanceStatusInfo])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance.DBInstance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance.DBInstance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance.DBInstance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance.DBInstance
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance.DBInstance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance.DBInstance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBInstance.DBInstance


module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types.DBCluster

-- | Detailed information about a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBCluster</a> smart constructor.
data DBCluster
DBCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DBClusterMember] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DBClusterRole] -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DBCluster

-- | Indicates the database engine version.
[$sel:engineVersion:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the current state of this cluster.
[$sel:status:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted
--   unless it is modified and <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled.
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> protects clusters from being accidentally
--   deleted.
[$sel:deletionProtection:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the cluster is encrypted.
[$sel:storageEncrypted:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Contains a user-supplied cluster identifier. This identifier is the
--   unique key that identifies a cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the list of instances that make up the cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterMembers:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [DBClusterMember]

-- | Contains one or more identifiers of the secondary clusters that are
--   associated with this cluster.
[$sel:readReplicaIdentifiers:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Contains the identifier of the source cluster if this cluster is a
--   secondary cluster.
[$sel:replicationSourceIdentifier:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted
--   zone.
[$sel:hostedZoneId:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the cluster parameter group for the cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterParameterGroup:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the master user name for the cluster.
[$sel:masterUsername:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the cluster. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the cluster is accessed.
[$sel:dbClusterResourceId:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The earliest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
[$sel:earliestRestorableTime:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
[$sel:engine:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterArn:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
[$sel:latestRestorableTime:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can
--   occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the list of Amazon EC2 Availability Zones that instances in
--   the cluster can be created in.
[$sel:availabilityZones:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | If <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier
--   for the encrypted cluster.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are
--   created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the
--   <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
[$sel:preferredBackupWindow:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides a list of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that
--   are associated with the cluster. (IAM) roles that are associated with
--   a cluster grant permission for the cluster to access other Amazon Web
--   Services services on your behalf.
[$sel:associatedRoles:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [DBClusterRole]

-- | Provides a list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that
--   the cluster belongs to.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership]

-- | Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are
--   retained.
[$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
[$sel:dbSubnetGroup:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the cluster has instances in multiple Availability
--   Zones.
[$sel:multiAZ:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of log types that this cluster is configured to export to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:enabledCloudwatchLogsExports:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies the time when the cluster was created, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:clusterCreateTime:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Specifies the connection endpoint for the primary instance of the
--   cluster.
[$sel:endpoint:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the progress of the operation as a percentage.
[$sel:percentProgress:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a cluster
--   load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB replicas that
--   are available in a cluster. As clients request new connections to the
--   reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the connection requests
--   among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the cluster. This
--   functionality can help balance your read workload across multiple
--   Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.
--   
--   If a failover occurs, and the Amazon DocumentDB replica that you are
--   connected to is promoted to be the primary instance, your connection
--   is dropped. To continue sending your read workload to other Amazon
--   DocumentDB replicas in the cluster, you can then reconnect to the
--   reader endpoint.
[$sel:readerEndpoint:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.
[$sel:port:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DBCluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_engineVersion</a> -
--   Indicates the database engine version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_status</a> - Specifies the
--   current state of this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_deletionProtection</a> - Specifies whether this cluster
--   can be deleted. If <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster
--   cannot be deleted unless it is modified and

--   protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.

--   encrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - Contains a user-supplied
--   cluster identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies

--   that make up the cluster.

--   <a>$sel:readReplicaIdentifiers:DBCluster'</a>,

--   identifiers of the secondary clusters that are associated with this
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationSourceIdentifier:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_replicationSourceIdentifier</a> - Contains the identifier
--   of the source cluster if this cluster is a secondary cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostedZoneId:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_hostedZoneId</a> -
--   Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted
--   zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterParameterGroup:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterParameterGroup</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   cluster parameter group for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUsername:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_masterUsername</a>

--

--   database can be restored with point-in-time restore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_engine</a> - Provides the
--   name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterArn:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_dbClusterArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestRestorableTime:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_latestRestorableTime</a> - Specifies the latest time to

--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:DBCluster'</a>,

--   time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_availabilityZones</a> - Provides the list of Amazon EC2
--   Availability Zones that instances in the cluster can be created in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_kmsKeyId</a> - If
--   <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier for
--   the encrypted cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:DBCluster'</a>,

--   range during which automated backups are created if automated backups

--   <a>$sel:associatedRoles:DBCluster'</a>,

--   operation as a percentage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readerEndpoint:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_readerEndpoint</a>
--   - The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a
--   cluster load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB
--   replicas that are available in a cluster. As clients request new
--   connections to the reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the
--   connection requests among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the
--   cluster. This functionality can help balance your read workload across
--   multiple Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.
--   
--   If a failover occurs, and the Amazon DocumentDB replica that you are
--   connected to is promoted to be the primary instance, your connection
--   is dropped. To continue sending your read workload to other Amazon

--   reader endpoint.

dbCluster_percentProgress :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

--   are available in a cluster. As clients request new connections to the
--   reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the connection requests
--   among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the cluster. This

--   DocumentDB replicas in the cluster, you can then reconnect to the
--   reader endpoint.

module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Types

-- | API version <tt>2014-10-31</tt> of the Amazon DocumentDB with MongoDB
--   compatibility SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The parameter group is in use, or it is in a state that is not valid.
--   If you are trying to delete the parameter group, you can't delete it
--   when the parameter group is in this state.
_InvalidDBParameterGroupStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested source could not be found.
_SourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>CertificateIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   certificate.
_CertificateNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You already have a cluster snapshot with the given identifier.
_DBClusterSnapshotAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A parameter group with the same name already exists.
_DBParameterGroupAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of parameter
--   groups.
_DBParameterGroupQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cluster doesn't have enough capacity for the current operation.
_InsufficientDBClusterCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided category does not exist.
_SubscriptionCategoryNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subscription name does not exist.
_SubscriptionNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested subnet is not valid, or multiple subnets were requested
--   that are not all in a common virtual private cloud (VPC).
_InvalidSubnet :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have exceeded the maximum number of accounts that you can share a
--   manual DB snapshot with.
_SharedSnapshotQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of subnets in
--   a subnet group.
_DBSubnetQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The <tt>GlobalClusterIdentifier</tt> already exists. Choose a new
--   global cluster identifier (unique name) to create a new global
--   cluster.
_GlobalClusterAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBClusterIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing cluster.
_DBClusterNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You already have a cluster with the given identifier.
_DBClusterAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Storage of the specified <tt>StorageType</tt> can't be associated with
--   the DB instance.
_StorageTypeNotSupportedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The SNS topic Amazon Resource Name (ARN) does not exist.
_SNSTopicArnNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Someone else might be modifying a subscription. Wait a few seconds,
--   and try again.
_InvalidEventSubscriptionStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error occurred when accessing an KMS key.
_KMSKeyNotAccessibleFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSnapshotIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing snapshot.
_DBSnapshotNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBClusterParameterGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   cluster parameter group.
_DBClusterParameterGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cluster can't be created because you have reached the maximum
--   allowed quota of clusters.
_DBClusterQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of snapshots.
_SnapshotQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSubnetGroupName</tt> is already being used by an existing subnet
--   group.
_DBSubnetGroupAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You do not have permission to publish to the SNS topic Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN).
_SNSNoAuthorizationFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSecurityGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing security
--   group.
_DBSecurityGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of instances.
_InstanceQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBParameterGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing parameter
--   group.
_DBParameterGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet isn't in the <i>available</i> state.
_InvalidDBSubnetStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   cluster snapshot.
_DBClusterSnapshotNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Amazon SNS has responded that there is a problem with the specified
--   topic.
_SNSInvalidTopicFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified instance class isn't available in the specified
--   Availability Zone.
_InsufficientDBInstanceCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided value isn't a valid cluster snapshot state.
_InvalidDBClusterSnapshotStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided subscription name already exists.
_SubscriptionAlreadyExistFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet group doesn't cover all Availability Zones after it is
--   created because of changes that were made.
_InvalidVPCNetworkStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified CIDR IP or Amazon EC2 security group isn't authorized
--   for the specified security group.
--   
--   Amazon DocumentDB also might not be authorized to perform necessary
--   actions on your behalf using IAM.
_AuthorizationNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of subnet
--   groups.
_DBSubnetGroupQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested operation can't be performed while the cluster is in
--   this state.
_InvalidGlobalClusterStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have reached the maximum number of event subscriptions.
_EventSubscriptionQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There is not enough storage available for the current action. You
--   might be able to resolve this error by updating your subnet group to
--   use different Availability Zones that have more storage available.
_InsufficientStorageClusterCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cluster isn't in a valid state.
_InvalidDBClusterStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The <tt>GlobalClusterIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   global cluster.
_GlobalClusterNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You already have a instance with the given identifier.
_DBInstanceAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You cannot restore from a virtual private cloud (VPC) backup to a
--   non-VPC DB instance.
_InvalidRestoreFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The state of the security group doesn't allow deletion.
_InvalidDBSecurityGroupStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource ID was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSubnetGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing subnet group.
_DBSubnetGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The upgrade failed because a resource that the depends on can't be
--   modified.
_DBUpgradeDependencyFailureFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified instance isn't in the <i>available</i> state.
_InvalidDBInstanceStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSnapshotIdentifier</tt> is already being used by an existing
--   snapshot.
_DBSnapshotAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBInstanceIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing instance.
_DBInstanceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed amount of storage
--   available across all instances.
_StorageQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The state of the snapshot doesn't allow deletion.
_InvalidDBSnapshotStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet group can't be deleted because it's in use.
_InvalidDBSubnetGroupStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The number of global clusters for this account is already at the
--   maximum allowed.
_GlobalClusterQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Subnets in the subnet group should cover at least two Availability
--   Zones unless there is only one Availability Zone.
_DBSubnetGroupDoesNotCoverEnoughAZs :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet is already in use in the Availability Zone.
_SubnetAlreadyInUse :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype ApplyMethod
ApplyMethod' :: Text -> ApplyMethod
[fromApplyMethod] :: ApplyMethod -> Text
pattern ApplyMethod_Immediate :: ApplyMethod
pattern ApplyMethod_Pending_reboot :: ApplyMethod
newtype SourceType
SourceType' :: Text -> SourceType
[fromSourceType] :: SourceType -> Text
pattern SourceType_Db_cluster :: SourceType
pattern SourceType_Db_cluster_snapshot :: SourceType
pattern SourceType_Db_instance :: SourceType
pattern SourceType_Db_parameter_group :: SourceType
pattern SourceType_Db_security_group :: SourceType
pattern SourceType_Db_snapshot :: SourceType

-- | Information about an Availability Zone.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAvailabilityZone</a> smart constructor.
data AvailabilityZone
AvailabilityZone' :: Maybe Text -> AvailabilityZone

-- | The name of the Availability Zone.
[$sel:name:AvailabilityZone'] :: AvailabilityZone -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AvailabilityZone</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AvailabilityZone'</a>, <a>availabilityZone_name</a> - The
--   name of the Availability Zone.
newAvailabilityZone :: AvailabilityZone

-- | The name of the Availability Zone.
availabilityZone_name :: Lens' AvailabilityZone (Maybe Text)

-- | A certificate authority (CA) certificate for an account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data Certificate
Certificate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Certificate

-- | The type of the certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>CA</tt>
[$sel:certificateType:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>arn:aws:rds:us-east-1::cert:rds-ca-2019</tt>
[$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The date-time after which the certificate is no longer valid.
--   
--   Example: <tt>2024-07-31T17:57:09Z</tt>
[$sel:validTill:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The unique key that identifies a certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>rds-ca-2019</tt>
[$sel:certificateIdentifier:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The thumbprint of the certificate.
[$sel:thumbprint:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The starting date-time from which the certificate is valid.
--   
--   Example: <tt>2019-07-31T17:57:09Z</tt>
[$sel:validFrom:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateType:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateType</a> - The type of the certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>CA</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for
--   the certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>arn:aws:rds:us-east-1::cert:rds-ca-2019</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:validTill:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_validTill</a> - The
--   date-time after which the certificate is no longer valid.
--   
--   Example: <tt>2024-07-31T17:57:09Z</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateIdentifier:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateIdentifier</a> - The unique key that
--   identifies a certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>rds-ca-2019</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:thumbprint:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_thumbprint</a> -
--   The thumbprint of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validFrom:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_validFrom</a> - The
--   starting date-time from which the certificate is valid.
--   
--   Example: <tt>2019-07-31T17:57:09Z</tt>
newCertificate :: Certificate

-- | The type of the certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>CA</tt>
certificate_certificateType :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>arn:aws:rds:us-east-1::cert:rds-ca-2019</tt>
certificate_certificateArn :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The date-time after which the certificate is no longer valid.
--   
--   Example: <tt>2024-07-31T17:57:09Z</tt>
certificate_validTill :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique key that identifies a certificate.
--   
--   Example: <tt>rds-ca-2019</tt>
certificate_certificateIdentifier :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The thumbprint of the certificate.
certificate_thumbprint :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The starting date-time from which the certificate is valid.
--   
--   Example: <tt>2019-07-31T17:57:09Z</tt>
certificate_validFrom :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The configuration setting for the log types to be enabled for export
--   to Amazon CloudWatch Logs for a specific instance or cluster.
--   
--   The <tt>EnableLogTypes</tt> and <tt>DisableLogTypes</tt> arrays
--   determine which logs are exported (or not exported) to CloudWatch
--   Logs. The values within these arrays depend on the engine that is
--   being used.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration
CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration

-- | The list of log types to disable.
[$sel:disableLogTypes:CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration'] :: CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The list of log types to enable.
[$sel:enableLogTypes:CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration'] :: CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:disableLogTypes:CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration_disableLogTypes</a> - The list of
--   log types to disable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableLogTypes:CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration_enableLogTypes</a> - The list of
--   log types to enable.
newCloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration :: CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration

-- | The list of log types to disable.
cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration_disableLogTypes :: Lens' CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration (Maybe [Text])

-- | The list of log types to enable.
cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration_enableLogTypes :: Lens' CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration (Maybe [Text])

-- | Detailed information about a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBCluster</a> smart constructor.
data DBCluster
DBCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DBClusterMember] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DBClusterRole] -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DBCluster

-- | Indicates the database engine version.
[$sel:engineVersion:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the current state of this cluster.
[$sel:status:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted
--   unless it is modified and <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled.
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> protects clusters from being accidentally
--   deleted.
[$sel:deletionProtection:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the cluster is encrypted.
[$sel:storageEncrypted:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Contains a user-supplied cluster identifier. This identifier is the
--   unique key that identifies a cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the list of instances that make up the cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterMembers:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [DBClusterMember]

-- | Contains one or more identifiers of the secondary clusters that are
--   associated with this cluster.
[$sel:readReplicaIdentifiers:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Contains the identifier of the source cluster if this cluster is a
--   secondary cluster.
[$sel:replicationSourceIdentifier:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted
--   zone.
[$sel:hostedZoneId:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the cluster parameter group for the cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterParameterGroup:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the master user name for the cluster.
[$sel:masterUsername:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the cluster. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the cluster is accessed.
[$sel:dbClusterResourceId:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The earliest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
[$sel:earliestRestorableTime:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
[$sel:engine:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterArn:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
[$sel:latestRestorableTime:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can
--   occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the list of Amazon EC2 Availability Zones that instances in
--   the cluster can be created in.
[$sel:availabilityZones:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | If <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier
--   for the encrypted cluster.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are
--   created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the
--   <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
[$sel:preferredBackupWindow:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides a list of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that
--   are associated with the cluster. (IAM) roles that are associated with
--   a cluster grant permission for the cluster to access other Amazon Web
--   Services services on your behalf.
[$sel:associatedRoles:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [DBClusterRole]

-- | Provides a list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that
--   the cluster belongs to.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership]

-- | Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are
--   retained.
[$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
[$sel:dbSubnetGroup:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the cluster has instances in multiple Availability
--   Zones.
[$sel:multiAZ:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of log types that this cluster is configured to export to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:enabledCloudwatchLogsExports:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies the time when the cluster was created, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:clusterCreateTime:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Specifies the connection endpoint for the primary instance of the
--   cluster.
[$sel:endpoint:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the progress of the operation as a percentage.
[$sel:percentProgress:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a cluster
--   load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB replicas that
--   are available in a cluster. As clients request new connections to the
--   reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the connection requests
--   among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the cluster. This
--   functionality can help balance your read workload across multiple
--   Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.
--   
--   If a failover occurs, and the Amazon DocumentDB replica that you are
--   connected to is promoted to be the primary instance, your connection
--   is dropped. To continue sending your read workload to other Amazon
--   DocumentDB replicas in the cluster, you can then reconnect to the
--   reader endpoint.
[$sel:readerEndpoint:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.
[$sel:port:DBCluster'] :: DBCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DBCluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_engineVersion</a> -
--   Indicates the database engine version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_status</a> - Specifies the
--   current state of this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_deletionProtection</a> - Specifies whether this cluster
--   can be deleted. If <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster
--   cannot be deleted unless it is modified and
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled. <tt>DeletionProtection</tt>
--   protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageEncrypted:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_storageEncrypted</a> - Specifies whether the cluster is
--   encrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - Contains a user-supplied
--   cluster identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies
--   a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterMembers:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterMembers</a> - Provides the list of instances
--   that make up the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readReplicaIdentifiers:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_readReplicaIdentifiers</a> - Contains one or more
--   identifiers of the secondary clusters that are associated with this
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationSourceIdentifier:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_replicationSourceIdentifier</a> - Contains the identifier
--   of the source cluster if this cluster is a secondary cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostedZoneId:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_hostedZoneId</a> -
--   Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted
--   zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterParameterGroup:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterParameterGroup</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   cluster parameter group for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUsername:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_masterUsername</a>
--   - Contains the master user name for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterResourceId:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterResourceId</a> - The Region-unique, immutable
--   identifier for the cluster. This identifier is found in CloudTrail log
--   entries whenever the KMS key for the cluster is accessed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:earliestRestorableTime:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_earliestRestorableTime</a> - The earliest time to which a
--   database can be restored with point-in-time restore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_engine</a> - Provides the
--   name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterArn:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_dbClusterArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestRestorableTime:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_latestRestorableTime</a> - Specifies the latest time to
--   which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - Specifies the weekly
--   time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_availabilityZones</a> - Provides the list of Amazon EC2
--   Availability Zones that instances in the cluster can be created in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_kmsKeyId</a> - If
--   <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier for
--   the encrypted cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_preferredBackupWindow</a> - Specifies the daily time
--   range during which automated backups are created if automated backups
--   are enabled, as determined by the <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associatedRoles:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_associatedRoles</a> - Provides a list of the Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) roles that are associated with the cluster.
--   (IAM) roles that are associated with a cluster grant permission for
--   the cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services on your
--   behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_vpcSecurityGroups</a> - Provides a list of virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_backupRetentionPeriod</a> - Specifies the number of days
--   for which automatic snapshots are retained.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroup:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_dbSubnetGroup</a> -
--   Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiAZ:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_multiAZ</a> - Specifies
--   whether the cluster has instances in multiple Availability Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabledCloudwatchLogsExports:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_enabledCloudwatchLogsExports</a> - A list of log types
--   that this cluster is configured to export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCreateTime:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_clusterCreateTime</a> - Specifies the time when the
--   cluster was created, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_endpoint</a> - Specifies
--   the connection endpoint for the primary instance of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentProgress:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_percentProgress</a> - Specifies the progress of the
--   operation as a percentage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readerEndpoint:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_readerEndpoint</a>
--   - The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a
--   cluster load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB
--   replicas that are available in a cluster. As clients request new
--   connections to the reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the
--   connection requests among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the
--   cluster. This functionality can help balance your read workload across
--   multiple Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.
--   
--   If a failover occurs, and the Amazon DocumentDB replica that you are
--   connected to is promoted to be the primary instance, your connection
--   is dropped. To continue sending your read workload to other Amazon
--   DocumentDB replicas in the cluster, you can then reconnect to the
--   reader endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_port</a> - Specifies the
--   port that the database engine is listening on.
newDBCluster :: DBCluster

-- | Indicates the database engine version.
dbCluster_engineVersion :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the current state of this cluster.
dbCluster_status :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted
--   unless it is modified and <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled.
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> protects clusters from being accidentally
--   deleted.
dbCluster_deletionProtection :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the cluster is encrypted.
dbCluster_storageEncrypted :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Contains a user-supplied cluster identifier. This identifier is the
--   unique key that identifies a cluster.
dbCluster_dbClusterIdentifier :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the list of instances that make up the cluster.
dbCluster_dbClusterMembers :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe [DBClusterMember])

-- | Contains one or more identifiers of the secondary clusters that are
--   associated with this cluster.
dbCluster_readReplicaIdentifiers :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe [Text])

-- | Contains the identifier of the source cluster if this cluster is a
--   secondary cluster.
dbCluster_replicationSourceIdentifier :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted
--   zone.
dbCluster_hostedZoneId :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the cluster parameter group for the cluster.
dbCluster_dbClusterParameterGroup :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the master user name for the cluster.
dbCluster_masterUsername :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the cluster. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the cluster is accessed.
dbCluster_dbClusterResourceId :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The earliest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
dbCluster_earliestRestorableTime :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
dbCluster_engine :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster.
dbCluster_dbClusterArn :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with
--   point-in-time restore.
dbCluster_latestRestorableTime :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can
--   occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
dbCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the list of Amazon EC2 Availability Zones that instances in
--   the cluster can be created in.
dbCluster_availabilityZones :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe [Text])

-- | If <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier
--   for the encrypted cluster.
dbCluster_kmsKeyId :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are
--   created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the
--   <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
dbCluster_preferredBackupWindow :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides a list of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that
--   are associated with the cluster. (IAM) roles that are associated with
--   a cluster grant permission for the cluster to access other Amazon Web
--   Services services on your behalf.
dbCluster_associatedRoles :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe [DBClusterRole])

-- | Provides a list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that
--   the cluster belongs to.
dbCluster_vpcSecurityGroups :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership])

-- | Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are
--   retained.
dbCluster_backupRetentionPeriod :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
dbCluster_dbSubnetGroup :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the cluster has instances in multiple Availability
--   Zones.
dbCluster_multiAZ :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of log types that this cluster is configured to export to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
dbCluster_enabledCloudwatchLogsExports :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies the time when the cluster was created, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
dbCluster_clusterCreateTime :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the connection endpoint for the primary instance of the
--   cluster.
dbCluster_endpoint :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the progress of the operation as a percentage.
dbCluster_percentProgress :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a cluster
--   load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB replicas that
--   are available in a cluster. As clients request new connections to the
--   reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the connection requests
--   among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the cluster. This
--   functionality can help balance your read workload across multiple
--   Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.
--   
--   If a failover occurs, and the Amazon DocumentDB replica that you are
--   connected to is promoted to be the primary instance, your connection
--   is dropped. To continue sending your read workload to other Amazon
--   DocumentDB replicas in the cluster, you can then reconnect to the
--   reader endpoint.
dbCluster_readerEndpoint :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.
dbCluster_port :: Lens' DBCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Contains information about an instance that is part of a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBClusterMember</a> smart constructor.
data DBClusterMember
DBClusterMember' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> DBClusterMember

-- | A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica
--   is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing
--   primary instance.

-- | A value that is <tt>true</tt> if the cluster member is the primary
--   instance for the cluster and <tt>false</tt> otherwise.
[$sel:isClusterWriter:DBClusterMember'] :: DBClusterMember -> Maybe Bool

--   the DB cluster.

--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This value is stored as a lowercase string.
