-- | Creates a new cluster from a snapshot or cluster snapshot.
--   
--   If a snapshot is specified, the target cluster is created from the
--   source DB snapshot with a default configuration and default security
--   group.
--   
--   If a cluster snapshot is specified, the target cluster is created from
--   the source cluster restore point with the same configuration as the
--   original source DB cluster, except that the new cluster is created
--   with the default security group.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot

-- | Represents the input to RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot
RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot

-- | The version of the database engine to use for the new cluster.
[$sel:engineVersion:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted
--   unless it is modified and <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled.
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> protects clusters from being accidentally
--   deleted.
[$sel:deletionProtection:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the subnet group to use for the new cluster.
--   
--   Constraints: If provided, must match the name of an existing
--   <tt>DBSubnetGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Example: <tt>mySubnetgroup</tt>
[$sel:dbSubnetGroupName:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides the list of Amazon EC2 Availability Zones that instances in
--   the restored DB cluster can be created in.
[$sel:availabilityZones:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The KMS key identifier to use when restoring an encrypted cluster from
--   a DB snapshot or cluster snapshot.
--   
--   The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS
--   encryption key. If you are restoring a cluster with the same account
--   that owns the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the new cluster, then
--   you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS
--   encryption key.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter,
--   then the following occurs:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the snapshot or cluster snapshot in <tt>SnapshotIdentifier</tt>
--   is encrypted, then the restored cluster is encrypted using the KMS key
--   that was used to encrypt the snapshot or the cluster snapshot.</li>
--   <li>If the snapshot or the cluster snapshot in
--   <tt>SnapshotIdentifier</tt> is not encrypted, then the restored DB
--   cluster is not encrypted.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:kmsKeyId:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that the new
--   cluster will belong to.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The tags to be assigned to the restored cluster.
[$sel:tags:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The port number on which the new cluster accepts connections.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be a value from <tt>1150</tt> to <tt>65535</tt>.
--   
--   Default: The same port as the original cluster.
[$sel:port:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | A list of log types that must be enabled for exporting to Amazon
--   CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:enableCloudwatchLogsExports:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the cluster to create from the snapshot or cluster
--   snapshot. This parameter isn't case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-snapshot-id</tt>
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Text

-- | The identifier for the snapshot or cluster snapshot to restore from.
--   
--   You can use either the name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to
--   specify a cluster snapshot. However, you can use only the ARN to
--   specify a snapshot.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing snapshot.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:snapshotIdentifier:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Text

-- | The database engine to use for the new cluster.
--   
--   Default: The same as source.
--   
--   Constraint: Must be compatible with the engine of the source.
[$sel:engine:RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot'] :: RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot -> Text

-- | Modifies the parameters of a cluster parameter group to the default
--   value. To reset specific parameters, submit a list of the following:
--   <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ApplyMethod</tt>. To reset the entire
--   cluster parameter group, specify the
--   <tt>DBClusterParameterGroupName</tt> and <tt>ResetAllParameters</tt>
--   parameters.
--   
--   When you reset the entire group, dynamic parameters are updated
--   immediately and static parameters are set to <tt>pending-reboot</tt>
--   to take effect on the next DB instance reboot.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.ResetDBClusterParameterGroup

-- | Represents the input to ResetDBClusterParameterGroup.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResetDBClusterParameterGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ResetDBClusterParameterGroup
ResetDBClusterParameterGroup' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Parameter] -> Text -> ResetDBClusterParameterGroup

-- | A value that is set to <tt>true</tt> to reset all parameters in the
--   cluster parameter group to their default values, and <tt>false</tt>
--   otherwise. You can't use this parameter if there is a list of
--   parameter names specified for the <tt>Parameters</tt> parameter.
[$sel:resetAllParameters:ResetDBClusterParameterGroup'] :: ResetDBClusterParameterGroup -> Maybe Bool

-- | Detaches an Amazon DocumentDB secondary cluster from a global cluster.

--   This action only applies to Amazon DocumentDB clusters.

-- | You might need to reboot your instance, usually for maintenance
--   reasons. For example, if you make certain changes, or if you change
--   the cluster parameter group that is associated with the instance, you
--   must reboot the instance for the changes to take effect.
--   
--   Rebooting an instance restarts the database engine service. Rebooting
--   an instance results in a momentary outage, during which the instance
--   status is set to <i>rebooting</i>.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.RebootDBInstance

-- | Represents the input to RebootDBInstance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRebootDBInstance</a> smart constructor.
data RebootDBInstance
RebootDBInstance' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> RebootDBInstance

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the reboot is conducted through a Multi-AZ
--   failover.
--   
--   Constraint: You can't specify <tt>true</tt> if the instance is not
--   configured for Multi-AZ.
[$sel:forceFailover:RebootDBInstance'] :: RebootDBInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase
--   string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBInstance</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:RebootDBInstance'] :: RebootDBInstance -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RebootDBInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   is conducted through a Multi-AZ failover.
--   
--   Constraint: You can't specify <tt>true</tt> if the instance is not
--   configured for Multi-AZ.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:RebootDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rebootDBInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier</a> - The instance
--   identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBInstance</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
newRebootDBInstance :: Text -> RebootDBInstance

--   failover.
--   
--   Constraint: You can't specify <tt>true</tt> if the instance is not

rebootDBInstance_forceFailover :: Lens' RebootDBInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | Modify a setting for an Amazon DocumentDB global cluster. You can
--   change one or more configuration parameters (for example: deletion
--   protection), or the global cluster identifier by specifying these
--   parameters and the new values in the request.
--   
--   This action only applies to Amazon DocumentDB clusters.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.ModifyGlobalCluster

-- | Represents the input to ModifyGlobalCluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyGlobalCluster</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyGlobalCluster
ModifyGlobalCluster' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ModifyGlobalCluster

-- | Indicates if the global cluster has deletion protection enabled. The
--   global cluster can't be deleted when deletion protection is enabled.
[$sel:deletionProtection:ModifyGlobalCluster'] :: ModifyGlobalCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The new identifier for a global cluster when you modify a global
--   cluster. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphensThe first
--   character must be a letterCan't end with a hyphen or contain two
--   consecutive hyphens</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-cluster2</tt>
[$sel:newGlobalClusterIdentifier':ModifyGlobalCluster'] :: ModifyGlobalCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the global cluster being modified. This parameter
--   isn't case-sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing global cluster.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:globalClusterIdentifier:ModifyGlobalCluster'] :: ModifyGlobalCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyGlobalCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   subscription.

-- | Modifies settings for an instance. You can change one or more database
--   configuration parameters by specifying these parameters and the new
--   values in the request.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.ModifyDBInstance

-- | Represents the input to ModifyDBInstance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyDBInstance</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyDBInstance
ModifyDBInstance' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> ModifyDBInstance

-- | This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB
--   does not perform minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.
[$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The new instance identifier for the instance when renaming an
--   instance. When you change the instance identifier, an instance reboot
--   occurs immediately if you set <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt>. It occurs during the next maintenance window if you set
--   <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to <tt>false</tt>. This value is stored as
--   a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>mydbinstance</tt>
[$sel:newDBInstanceIdentifier':ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The new compute and memory capacity of the instance; for example,
--   <tt>db.r5.large</tt>. Not all instance classes are available in all
--   Regions.
--   
--   If you modify the instance class, an outage occurs during the change.
--   The change is applied during the next maintenance window, unless
--   <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> is specified as <tt>true</tt> for this
--   request.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
[$sel:dbInstanceClass:ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica
--   is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing
--   primary instance.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Valid values: 0-15
[$sel:promotionTier:ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can
--   occur, which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter
--   doesn't result in an outage except in the following situation, and the
--   change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If there are
--   pending actions that cause a reboot, and the maintenance window is
--   changed to include the current time, changing this parameter causes a
--   reboot of the instance. If you are moving this window to the current
--   time, there must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and
--   end of the window to ensure that pending changes are applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the certificate that needs to be associated with the
--   instance.
[$sel:cACertificateIdentifier:ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the modifications in this request and any pending
--   modifications are asynchronously applied as soon as possible,
--   regardless of the <tt>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> setting for the
--   instance.
--   
--   If this parameter is set to <tt>false</tt>, changes to the instance
--   are applied during the next maintenance window. Some parameter changes
--   can cause an outage and are applied on the next reboot.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance identifier. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBInstance</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:ModifyDBInstance'] :: ModifyDBInstance -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyDBInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> - This parameter does
--   not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB does not perform
--   minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newDBInstanceIdentifier':ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_newDBInstanceIdentifier</a> - The new instance
--   identifier for the instance when renaming an instance. When you change
--   the instance identifier, an instance reboot occurs immediately if you
--   set <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. It occurs during the
--   next maintenance window if you set <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to
--   <tt>false</tt>. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>mydbinstance</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceClass:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_dbInstanceClass</a> - The new compute and memory
--   capacity of the instance; for example, <tt>db.r5.large</tt>. Not all
--   instance classes are available in all Regions.
--   
--   If you modify the instance class, an outage occurs during the change.
--   The change is applied during the next maintenance window, unless
--   <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> is specified as <tt>true</tt> for this
--   request.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:promotionTier:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_promotionTier</a> - A value that specifies the
--   order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary
--   instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Valid values: 0-15
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The weekly time
--   range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur, which might
--   result in an outage. Changing this parameter doesn't result in an
--   outage except in the following situation, and the change is
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If there are pending
--   actions that cause a reboot, and the maintenance window is changed to
--   include the current time, changing this parameter causes a reboot of
--   the instance. If you are moving this window to the current time, there
--   must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and end of the
--   window to ensure that pending changes are applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cACertificateIdentifier:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_cACertificateIdentifier</a> - Indicates the
--   certificate that needs to be associated with the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_applyImmediately</a> - Specifies whether the
--   modifications in this request and any pending modifications are
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible, regardless of the
--   <tt>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> setting for the instance.
--   
--   If this parameter is set to <tt>false</tt>, changes to the instance
--   are applied during the next maintenance window. Some parameter changes
--   can cause an outage and are applied on the next reboot.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier</a> - The instance
--   identifier. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBInstance</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
newModifyDBInstance :: Text -> ModifyDBInstance

-- | This parameter does not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB
--   does not perform minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.
modifyDBInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The new instance identifier for the instance when renaming an
--   instance. When you change the instance identifier, an instance reboot
--   occurs immediately if you set <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt>. It occurs during the next maintenance window if you set
--   <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to <tt>false</tt>. This value is stored as
--   a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>mydbinstance</tt>
modifyDBInstance_newDBInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The new compute and memory capacity of the instance; for example,
--   <tt>db.r5.large</tt>. Not all instance classes are available in all
--   Regions.
--   
--   If you modify the instance class, an outage occurs during the change.
--   The change is applied during the next maintenance window, unless
--   <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> is specified as <tt>true</tt> for this
--   request.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
modifyDBInstance_dbInstanceClass :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica
--   is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing
--   primary instance.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Valid values: 0-15
modifyDBInstance_promotionTier :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can
--   occur, which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter
--   doesn't result in an outage except in the following situation, and the
--   change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If there are
--   pending actions that cause a reboot, and the maintenance window is
--   changed to include the current time, changing this parameter causes a
--   reboot of the instance. If you are moving this window to the current
--   time, there must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and
--   end of the window to ensure that pending changes are applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.
modifyDBInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the certificate that needs to be associated with the
--   instance.
modifyDBInstance_cACertificateIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the modifications in this request and any pending
--   modifications are asynchronously applied as soon as possible,
--   regardless of the <tt>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> setting for the
--   instance.
--   
--   If this parameter is set to <tt>false</tt>, changes to the instance
--   are applied during the next maintenance window. Some parameter changes
--   can cause an outage and are applied on the next reboot.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
modifyDBInstance_applyImmediately :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance identifier. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBInstance</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
modifyDBInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyDBInstance Text

-- | Adds an attribute and values to, or removes an attribute and values
--   from, a manual cluster snapshot.
--   
--   To share a manual cluster snapshot with other accounts, specify
--   <tt>restore</tt> as the <tt>AttributeName</tt>, and use the
--   <tt>ValuesToAdd</tt> parameter to add a list of IDs of the accounts
--   that are authorized to restore the manual cluster snapshot. Use the
--   value <tt>all</tt> to make the manual cluster snapshot public, which
--   means that it can be copied or restored by all accounts. Do not add
--   the <tt>all</tt> value for any manual cluster snapshots that contain
--   private information that you don't want available to all accounts. If
--   a manual cluster snapshot is encrypted, it can be shared, but only by
--   specifying a list of authorized account IDs for the
--   <tt>ValuesToAdd</tt> parameter. You can't use <tt>all</tt> as a value
--   for that parameter in this case.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute

-- | Represents the input to ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute
ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute

-- | A list of cluster snapshot attributes to add to the attribute
--   specified by <tt>AttributeName</tt>.
--   
--   To authorize other accounts to copy or restore a manual cluster
--   snapshot, set this list to include one or more account IDs. To make
--   the manual cluster snapshot restorable by any account, set it to
--   <tt>all</tt>. Do not add the <tt>all</tt> value for any manual cluster
--   snapshots that contain private information that you don't want to be
--   available to all accounts.
[$sel:valuesToAdd:ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute'] :: ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of cluster snapshot attributes to remove from the attribute
--   specified by <tt>AttributeName</tt>.
--   
--   To remove authorization for other accounts to copy or restore a manual
--   cluster snapshot, set this list to include one or more account
--   identifiers. To remove authorization for any account to copy or
--   restore the cluster snapshot, set it to <tt>all</tt> . If you specify
--   <tt>all</tt>, an account whose account ID is explicitly added to the
--   <tt>restore</tt> attribute can still copy or restore a manual cluster
--   snapshot.
[$sel:valuesToRemove:ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute'] :: ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The identifier for the cluster snapshot to modify the attributes for.
[$sel:dbClusterSnapshotIdentifier:ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute'] :: ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute -> Text

-- | The name of the cluster snapshot attribute to modify.
--   
--   To manage authorization for other accounts to copy or restore a manual
--   cluster snapshot, set this value to <tt>restore</tt>.
[$sel:attributeName:ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute'] :: ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   the manual cluster snapshot restorable by any account, set it to
--   <tt>all</tt>. Do not add the <tt>all</tt> value for any manual cluster

--   available to all accounts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:valuesToRemove:ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute_valuesToRemove</a> - A list of

--   <tt>AttributeName</tt>.

--   To remove authorization for other accounts to copy or restore a manual
--   cluster snapshot, set this list to include one or more account
--   identifiers. To remove authorization for any account to copy or
--   restore the cluster snapshot, set it to <tt>all</tt> . If you specify
--   <tt>all</tt>, an account whose account ID is explicitly added to the
--   <tt>restore</tt> attribute can still copy or restore a manual cluster

-- | Modifies the parameters of a cluster parameter group. To modify more
--   than one parameter, submit a list of the following:
--   <tt>ParameterName</tt>, <tt>ParameterValue</tt>, and
--   <tt>ApplyMethod</tt>. A maximum of 20 parameters can be modified in a
--   single request.
--   
--   Changes to dynamic parameters are applied immediately. Changes to
--   static parameters require a reboot or maintenance window before the
--   change can take effect.
--   
--   After you create a cluster parameter group, you should wait at least 5
--   minutes before creating your first cluster that uses that cluster
--   parameter group as the default parameter group. This allows Amazon
--   DocumentDB to fully complete the create action before the parameter
--   group is used as the default for a new cluster. This step is
--   especially important for parameters that are critical when creating
--   the default database for a cluster, such as the character set for the
--   default database defined by the <tt>character_set_database</tt>
--   parameter.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.ModifyDBClusterParameterGroup

-- | Represents the input to ModifyDBClusterParameterGroup.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyDBClusterParameterGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyDBClusterParameterGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyDBClusterParameterGroup</a> with all

--   in the cluster parameter group to modify.

-- | Modifies a setting for an Amazon DocumentDB cluster. You can change
--   one or more database configuration parameters by specifying these
--   parameters and the new values in the request.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.ModifyDBCluster

-- | Represents the input to ModifyDBCluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyDBCluster</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyDBCluster
ModifyDBCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ModifyDBCluster

-- | The version number of the database engine to which you want to
--   upgrade. Modifying engine version is not supported on Amazon
--   DocumentDB.
[$sel:engineVersion:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted
--   unless it is modified and <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled.
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> protects clusters from being accidentally
--   deleted.
[$sel:deletionProtection:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The password for the master database user. This password can contain
--   any printable ASCII character except forward slash (/), double quote
--   ("), or the "at" symbol (@).
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 100 characters.
[$sel:masterUserPassword:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration setting for the log types to be enabled for export
--   to Amazon CloudWatch Logs for a specific instance or cluster. The
--   <tt>EnableLogTypes</tt> and <tt>DisableLogTypes</tt> arrays determine
--   which logs are exported (or not exported) to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe CloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration

-- | The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in
--   Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region, occurring on a random day of the week.
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The daily time range during which automated backups are created if
--   automated backups are enabled, using the
--   <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt> parameter.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the format <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Must be in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:preferredBackupWindow:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of days for which automated backups are retained. You must
--   specify a minimum value of 1.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be a value from 1 to 35.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | A list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster
--   will belong to.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the cluster parameter group to use for the cluster.
[$sel:dbClusterParameterGroupName:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that specifies whether the changes in this request and any
--   pending changes are asynchronously applied as soon as possible,
--   regardless of the <tt>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> setting for the
--   cluster. If this parameter is set to <tt>false</tt>, changes to the
--   cluster are applied during the next maintenance window.
--   
--   The <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> parameter affects only the
--   <tt>NewDBClusterIdentifier</tt> and <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt>
--   values. If you set this parameter value to <tt>false</tt>, the changes
--   to the <tt>NewDBClusterIdentifier</tt> and <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt>
--   values are applied during the next maintenance window. All other
--   changes are applied immediately, regardless of the value of the
--   <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> parameter.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The new cluster identifier for the cluster when renaming a cluster.
--   This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-cluster2</tt>
[$sel:newDBClusterIdentifier':ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The port number on which the cluster accepts connections.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be a value from <tt>1150</tt> to <tt>65535</tt>.
--   
--   Default: The same port as the original cluster.
[$sel:port:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Maybe Int

--   parameter is not case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:ModifyDBCluster'] :: ModifyDBCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyDBCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   database engine to which you want to upgrade. Modifying engine version
--   is not supported on Amazon DocumentDB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_deletionProtection</a> - Specifies whether this
--   cluster can be deleted. If <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the
--   cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled. <tt>DeletionProtection</tt>
--   protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUserPassword:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_masterUserPassword</a> - The password for the
--   master database user. This password can contain any printable ASCII
--   character except forward slash (/), double quote ("), or the "at"
--   symbol (@).
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 100 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration setting for the log types to be enabled for export to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs for a specific instance or cluster. The
--   <tt>EnableLogTypes</tt> and <tt>DisableLogTypes</tt> arrays determine
--   which logs are exported (or not exported) to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The weekly time
--   range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region, occurring on a random day of the week.
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_preferredBackupWindow</a> - The daily time range
--   during which automated backups are created if automated backups are
--   enabled, using the <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt> parameter.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the format <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Must be in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_backupRetentionPeriod</a> - The number of days for
--   which automated backups are retained. You must specify a minimum value
--   of 1.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be a value from 1 to 35.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_vpcSecurityGroupIds</a> - A list of virtual private
--   cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster will belong to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterParameterGroupName:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_dbClusterParameterGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   cluster parameter group to use for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_applyImmediately</a> - A value that specifies
--   whether the changes in this request and any pending changes are
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible, regardless of the
--   <tt>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> setting for the cluster. If this
--   parameter is set to <tt>false</tt>, changes to the cluster are applied
--   during the next maintenance window.
--   
--   The <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> parameter affects only the
--   <tt>NewDBClusterIdentifier</tt> and <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt>
--   values. If you set this parameter value to <tt>false</tt>, the changes
--   to the <tt>NewDBClusterIdentifier</tt> and <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt>
--   values are applied during the next maintenance window. All other
--   changes are applied immediately, regardless of the value of the
--   <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> parameter.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:newDBClusterIdentifier':ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_newDBClusterIdentifier</a> - The new cluster
--   identifier for the cluster when renaming a cluster. This value is
--   stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-cluster2</tt>

-- | Forces a failover for a cluster.
--   
--   A failover for a cluster promotes one of the Amazon DocumentDB
--   replicas (read-only instances) in the cluster to be the primary
--   instance (the cluster writer).
--   
--   If the primary instance fails, Amazon DocumentDB automatically fails
--   over to an Amazon DocumentDB replica, if one exists. You can force a
--   failover when you want to simulate a failure of a primary instance for
--   testing.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.FailoverDBCluster

-- | Represents the input to FailoverDBCluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailoverDBCluster</a> smart constructor.
data FailoverDBCluster
FailoverDBCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailoverDBCluster

-- | A cluster identifier to force a failover for. This parameter is not
--   case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:FailoverDBCluster'] :: FailoverDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the instance to promote to the primary instance.
--   
--   You must specify the instance identifier for an Amazon DocumentDB
--   replica in the cluster. For example, <tt>mydbcluster-replica1</tt>.
[$sel:targetDBInstanceIdentifier:FailoverDBCluster'] :: FailoverDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FailoverDBCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:FailoverDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>failoverDBCluster_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - A cluster identifier to
--   force a failover for. This parameter is not case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetDBInstanceIdentifier:FailoverDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>failoverDBCluster_targetDBInstanceIdentifier</a> - The name of the
--   instance to promote to the primary instance.
--   
--   You must specify the instance identifier for an Amazon DocumentDB
--   replica in the cluster. For example, <tt>mydbcluster-replica1</tt>.
newFailoverDBCluster :: FailoverDBCluster

-- | A cluster identifier to force a failover for. This parameter is not
--   case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
failoverDBCluster_dbClusterIdentifier :: Lens' FailoverDBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the instance to promote to the primary instance.
--   
--   You must specify the instance identifier for an Amazon DocumentDB
--   replica in the cluster. For example, <tt>mydbcluster-replica1</tt>.
failoverDBCluster_targetDBInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' FailoverDBCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newFailoverDBClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data FailoverDBClusterResponse

-- | Returns a list of resources (for example, instances) that have at
--   least one pending maintenance action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DescribePendingMaintenanceActions

-- | Represents the input to DescribePendingMaintenanceActions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePendingMaintenanceActions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribePendingMaintenanceActions
DescribePendingMaintenanceActions' :: Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> DescribePendingMaintenanceActions

-- | A filter that specifies one or more resources to return pending
--   maintenance actions for.
--   
--   Supported filters:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db-cluster-id</tt> - Accepts cluster identifiers and cluster
--   Amazon Resource Names (ARNs). The results list includes only pending
--   maintenance actions for the clusters identified by these ARNs.</li>
--   <li><tt>db-instance-id</tt> - Accepts instance identifiers and
--   instance ARNs. The results list includes only pending maintenance
--   actions for the DB instances identified by these ARNs.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filters:DescribePendingMaintenanceActions'] :: DescribePendingMaintenanceActions -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribePendingMaintenanceActions'] :: DescribePendingMaintenanceActions -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribePendingMaintenanceActions'] :: DescribePendingMaintenanceActions -> Maybe Int

-- | The ARN of a resource to return pending maintenance actions for.

-- | Returns information about Amazon DocumentDB global clusters. This API
--   supports pagination.
--   
--   This action only applies to Amazon DocumentDB clusters.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--

--   include information about the clusters identified by these ARNs.

-- | Returns events related to instances, security groups, snapshots, and
--   DB parameter groups for the past 14 days. You can obtain events
--   specific to a particular DB instance, security group, snapshot, or
--   parameter group by providing the name as a parameter. By default, the
--   events of the past hour are returned.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DescribeEvents

-- | Represents the input to DescribeEvents.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEvents</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEvents
DescribeEvents' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Int -> DescribeEvents

-- | The beginning of the time interval to retrieve events for, specified
--   in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   Example: 2009-07-08T18:00Z
[$sel:startTime:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The event source to retrieve events for. If no value is specified, all
--   events are returned.
[$sel:sourceType:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe SourceType

-- | This parameter is not currently supported.
[$sel:filters:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | The identifier of the event source for which events are returned. If
--   not specified, then all sources are included in the response.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If <tt>SourceIdentifier</tt> is provided, <tt>SourceType</tt> must
--   also be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBInstance</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBInstanceIdentifier</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBSecurityGroup</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBSecurityGroupName</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBParameterGroup</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBParameterGroupName</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBSnapshot</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBSnapshotIdentifier</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sourceIdentifier:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of event categories that trigger notifications for an event
--   notification subscription.
[$sel:eventCategories:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Int

-- | The end of the time interval for which to retrieve events, specified
--   in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   Example: 2009-07-08T18:00Z
[$sel:endTime:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The number of minutes to retrieve events for.
--   
--   Default: 60
[$sel:duration:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEvents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   - The beginning of the time interval to retrieve events for, specified
--   in ISO 8601 format.
--

--

--   <a>describeEvents_sourceType</a> - The event source to retrieve events
--   for. If no value is specified, all events are returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeEvents'</a>, <a>describeEvents_filters</a> -
--   This parameter is not currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdentifier:DescribeEvents'</a>,
--   <a>describeEvents_sourceIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the event

--   </ul>

--   The end of the time interval for which to retrieve events, specified
--   in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   Example: 2009-07-08T18:00Z
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:DescribeEvents'</a>, <a>describeEvents_duration</a> -
--   The number of minutes to retrieve events for.
--   
--   Default: 60
newDescribeEvents :: DescribeEvents

-- | Lists all the subscription descriptions for a customer account. The
--   description for a subscription includes <tt>SubscriptionName</tt>,
--   <tt>SNSTopicARN</tt>, <tt>CustomerID</tt>, <tt>SourceType</tt>,
--   <tt>SourceID</tt>, <tt>CreationTime</tt>, and <tt>Status</tt>.
--   
--   If you specify a <tt>SubscriptionName</tt>, lists the description for
--   that subscription.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DescribeEventSubscriptions

-- | Represents the input to DescribeEventSubscriptions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEventSubscriptions</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEventSubscriptions
DescribeEventSubscriptions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DescribeEventSubscriptions

--   you want to describe.

-- | This parameter is not currently supported.
[$sel:filters:DescribeEventSubscriptions'] :: DescribeEventSubscriptions -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeEventSubscriptions'] :: DescribeEventSubscriptions -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEventSubscriptions'] :: DescribeEventSubscriptions -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEventSubscriptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Amazon DocumentDB event notification subscription that you want to
--   describe.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeEventSubscriptions'</a>,
--   <a>describeEventSubscriptions_filters</a> - This parameter is not
--   currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeEventSubscriptions'</a>,
--   <a>describeEventSubscriptions_marker</a> - An optional pagination

-- | Displays a list of categories for all event source types, or, if
--   specified, for a specified source type.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DescribeEventCategories

-- | Represents the input to DescribeEventCategories.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEventCategories</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEventCategories
DescribeEventCategories' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Filter] -> DescribeEventCategories

--   
--   Valid values: <tt>db-instance</tt>, <tt>db-parameter-group</tt>,
--   <tt>db-security-group</tt>

[$sel:filters:DescribeEventCategories'] :: DescribeEventCategories -> Maybe [Filter]

--   <tt>db-security-group</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeEventCategories'</a>,
--   <a>describeEventCategories_filters</a> - This parameter is not
--   currently supported.

--

-- | Returns the default engine and system parameter information for the
--   cluster database engine.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DescribeEngineDefaultClusterParameters

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEngineDefaultClusterParameters</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEngineDefaultClusterParameters'] :: DescribeEngineDefaultClusterParameters -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the cluster parameter group family to return the engine
--   parameter information for.

--   all optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDBInstances</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDBInstances
DescribeDBInstances' :: Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DescribeDBInstances

-- | A filter that specifies one or more instances to describe.
--   
--   Supported filters:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db-cluster-id</tt> - Accepts cluster identifiers and cluster
--   Amazon Resource Names (ARNs). The results list includes only the
--   information about the instances that are associated with the clusters
--   that are identified by these ARNs.</li>
--   <li><tt>db-instance-id</tt> - Accepts instance identifiers and
--   instance ARNs. The results list includes only the information about
--   the instances that are identified by these ARNs.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filters:DescribeDBInstances'] :: DescribeDBInstances -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | The user-provided instance identifier. If this parameter is specified,
--   information from only the specific instance is returned. This
--   parameter isn't case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBInstance</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Returns a list of the available engines.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DescribeDBEngineVersions

-- | Represents the input to DescribeDBEngineVersions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDBEngineVersions</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDBEngineVersions
DescribeDBEngineVersions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DescribeDBEngineVersions

-- | The database engine version to return.
--   
--   Example: <tt>3.6.0</tt>
[$sel:engineVersion:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Text

-- | If this parameter is specified and the requested engine supports the
--   <tt>TimeZone</tt> parameter for <tt>CreateDBInstance</tt>, the
--   response includes a list of supported time zones for each engine
--   version.
[$sel:listSupportedTimezones:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Bool

-- | Indicates that only the default version of the specified engine or
--   engine and major version combination is returned.
[$sel:defaultOnly:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Bool

-- | This parameter is not currently supported.
[$sel:filters:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | The database engine to return.
[$sel:engine:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a specific parameter group family to return details for.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match an existing
--   <tt>DBParameterGroupFamily</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbParameterGroupFamily:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Text

--   <tt>CharacterSetName</tt> parameter for <tt>CreateDBInstance</tt>, the
--   response includes a list of supported character sets for each engine
--   version.
[$sel:listSupportedCharacterSets:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Bool

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeDBEngineVersions'] :: DescribeDBEngineVersions -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDBEngineVersions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:listSupportedTimezones:DescribeDBEngineVersions'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBEngineVersions_listSupportedTimezones</a> - If this
--   parameter is specified and the requested engine supports the
--   <tt>TimeZone</tt> parameter for <tt>CreateDBInstance</tt>, the
--   response includes a list of supported time zones for each engine
--   version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultOnly:DescribeDBEngineVersions'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBEngineVersions_defaultOnly</a> - Indicates that only the
--   default version of the specified engine or engine and major version
--   combination is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeDBEngineVersions'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBEngineVersions_filters</a> - This parameter is not
--   currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:DescribeDBEngineVersions'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBEngineVersions_engine</a> - The database engine to
--   return.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbParameterGroupFamily:DescribeDBEngineVersions'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBEngineVersions_dbParameterGroupFamily</a> - The name of a
--   specific parameter group family to return details for.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match an existing
--   <tt>DBParameterGroupFamily</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:listSupportedCharacterSets:DescribeDBEngineVersions'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBEngineVersions_listSupportedCharacterSets</a> - If this
--   parameter is specified and the requested engine supports the
--   <tt>CharacterSetName</tt> parameter for <tt>CreateDBInstance</tt>, the
--   response includes a list of supported character sets for each engine
--   version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeDBEngineVersions'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBEngineVersions_marker</a> - An optional pagination token
--   provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the
--   response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.

--   records to include in the response. If more records exist than the

--   retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100

--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

-- | Returns information about provisioned Amazon DocumentDB clusters. This
--   API operation supports pagination. For certain management features
--   such as cluster and instance lifecycle management, Amazon DocumentDB
--   leverages operational technology that is shared with Amazon RDS and
--   Amazon Neptune. Use the <tt>filterName=engine,Values=docdb</tt> filter
--   parameter to return only Amazon DocumentDB clusters.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Returns information about cluster snapshots. This API operation
--   supports pagination.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DescribeDBClusterSnapshots

-- | Represents the input to DescribeDBClusterSnapshots.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDBClusterSnapshots</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDBClusterSnapshots
DescribeDBClusterSnapshots' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> DescribeDBClusterSnapshots

-- | The ID of the cluster to retrieve the list of cluster snapshots for.
--   This parameter can't be used with the
--   <tt>DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> parameter. This parameter is not
--   case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to include shared manual cluster snapshots from
--   other accounts that this account has been given permission to copy or
--   restore, and otherwise <tt>false</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeShared:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe Bool

-- | A specific cluster snapshot identifier to describe. This parameter
--   can't be used with the <tt>DBClusterIdentifier</tt> parameter. This
--   value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBClusterSnapshot</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If this identifier is for an automated snapshot, the
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> parameter must also be specified.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbClusterSnapshotIdentifier:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe Text

-- | This parameter is not currently supported.
[$sel:filters:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | The type of cluster snapshots to be returned. You can specify one of
--   the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>automated</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that Amazon
--   DocumentDB has automatically created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>manual</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that you have
--   manually created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>shared</tt> - Return all manual cluster snapshots that have
--   been shared to your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that have been
--   marked as public.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify a <tt>SnapshotType</tt> value, then both
--   automated and manual cluster snapshots are returned. You can include
--   shared cluster snapshots with these results by setting the
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>. You can include
--   public cluster snapshots with these results by setting
--   the<tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>IncludeShared</tt> and <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameters don't
--   apply for <tt>SnapshotType</tt> values of <tt>manual</tt> or
--   <tt>automated</tt>. The <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter doesn't apply
--   when <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>shared</tt>. The
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter doesn't apply when
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>public</tt>.
[$sel:snapshotType:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe Int

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to include manual cluster snapshots that are
--   public and can be copied or restored by any account, and otherwise
--   <tt>false</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includePublic:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'] :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDBClusterSnapshots</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,

--   cluster to retrieve the list of cluster snapshots for. This parameter
--   can't be used with the <tt>DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> parameter.
--   This parameter is not case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeShared:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_includeShared</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt>
--   to include shared manual cluster snapshots from other accounts that
--   this account has been given permission to copy or restore, and
--   otherwise <tt>false</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterSnapshotIdentifier:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_dbClusterSnapshotIdentifier</a> - A
--   specific cluster snapshot identifier to describe. This parameter can't

--   <li>If this identifier is for an automated snapshot, the
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> parameter must also be specified.</li>
--   </ul>

--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_filters</a> - This parameter is not
--   currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotType:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_snapshotType</a> - The type of cluster
--   snapshots to be returned. You can specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>automated</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that Amazon
--   DocumentDB has automatically created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>manual</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that you have
--   manually created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>shared</tt> - Return all manual cluster snapshots that have
--   been shared to your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that have been
--   marked as public.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify a <tt>SnapshotType</tt> value, then both
--   automated and manual cluster snapshots are returned. You can include
--   shared cluster snapshots with these results by setting the
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>. You can include
--   public cluster snapshots with these results by setting
--   the<tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>IncludeShared</tt> and <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameters don't
--   apply for <tt>SnapshotType</tt> values of <tt>manual</tt> or
--   <tt>automated</tt>. The <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter doesn't apply
--   when <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>shared</tt>. The
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter doesn't apply when
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>public</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_marker</a> - An optional pagination
--   token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified,
--   the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRecords:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_maxRecords</a> - The maximum number of
--   records to include in the response. If more records exist than the
--   specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token (marker) is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includePublic:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_includePublic</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt>
--   to include manual cluster snapshots that are public and can be copied
--   or restored by any account, and otherwise <tt>false</tt>. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
newDescribeDBClusterSnapshots :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots

-- | The ID of the cluster to retrieve the list of cluster snapshots for.
--   This parameter can't be used with the
--   <tt>DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> parameter. This parameter is not
--   case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
describeDBClusterSnapshots_dbClusterIdentifier :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to include shared manual cluster snapshots from
--   other accounts that this account has been given permission to copy or
--   restore, and otherwise <tt>false</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
describeDBClusterSnapshots_includeShared :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe Bool)

-- | A specific cluster snapshot identifier to describe. This parameter
--   can't be used with the <tt>DBClusterIdentifier</tt> parameter. This
--   value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBClusterSnapshot</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If this identifier is for an automated snapshot, the
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> parameter must also be specified.</li>
--   </ul>
describeDBClusterSnapshots_dbClusterSnapshotIdentifier :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter is not currently supported.
describeDBClusterSnapshots_filters :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe [Filter])

-- | The type of cluster snapshots to be returned. You can specify one of
--   the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>automated</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that Amazon
--   DocumentDB has automatically created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>manual</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that you have
--   manually created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>shared</tt> - Return all manual cluster snapshots that have
--   been shared to your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that have been
--   marked as public.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify a <tt>SnapshotType</tt> value, then both
--   automated and manual cluster snapshots are returned. You can include
--   shared cluster snapshots with these results by setting the
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>. You can include
--   public cluster snapshots with these results by setting
--   the<tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>IncludeShared</tt> and <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameters don't
--   apply for <tt>SnapshotType</tt> values of <tt>manual</tt> or
--   <tt>automated</tt>. The <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter doesn't apply
--   when <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>shared</tt>. The
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter doesn't apply when
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>public</tt>.
describeDBClusterSnapshots_snapshotType :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
describeDBClusterSnapshots_marker :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token (marker) is included in the response so that the
--   remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
describeDBClusterSnapshots_maxRecords :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe Int)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to include manual cluster snapshots that are
--   public and can be copied or restored by any account, and otherwise
--   <tt>false</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
describeDBClusterSnapshots_includePublic :: Lens' DescribeDBClusterSnapshots (Maybe Bool)

-- | Returns a list of cluster snapshot attribute names and values for a
--   manual DB cluster snapshot.
--   
--   When you share snapshots with other accounts,
--   <tt>DescribeDBClusterSnapshotAttributes</tt> returns the
--   <tt>restore</tt> attribute and a list of IDs for the accounts that are
--   authorized to copy or restore the manual cluster snapshot. If
--   <tt>all</tt> is included in the list of values for the
--   <tt>restore</tt> attribute, then the manual cluster snapshot is public
--   and can be copied or restored by all accounts.

-- | Deletes a previously provisioned cluster. When you delete a cluster,
--   all automated backups for that cluster are deleted and can't be
--   recovered. Manual DB cluster snapshots of the specified cluster are
--   not deleted.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.DeleteDBCluster

-- | Represents the input to DeleteDBCluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteDBCluster</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteDBCluster
DeleteDBCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeleteDBCluster

-- | The cluster snapshot identifier of the new cluster snapshot created
--   when <tt>SkipFinalSnapshot</tt> is set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Specifying this parameter and also setting the
--   <tt>SkipFinalShapshot</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt> results in an
--   error.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be from 1 to 255 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:finalDBSnapshotIdentifier:DeleteDBCluster'] :: DeleteDBCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Determines whether a final cluster snapshot is created before the
--   cluster is deleted. If <tt>true</tt> is specified, no cluster snapshot
--   is created. If <tt>false</tt> is specified, a cluster snapshot is
--   created before the DB cluster is deleted.
--   
--   If <tt>SkipFinalSnapshot</tt> is <tt>false</tt>, you must specify a
--   <tt>FinalDBSnapshotIdentifier</tt> parameter.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:skipFinalSnapshot:DeleteDBCluster'] :: DeleteDBCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The cluster identifier for the cluster to be deleted. This parameter
--   isn't case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match an existing <tt>DBClusterIdentifier</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DeleteDBCluster'] :: DeleteDBCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteDBCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Creates an Amazon DocumentDB global cluster that can span multiple
--   multiple Regions. The global cluster contains one primary cluster with
--   read-write capability, and up-to give read-only secondary clusters.
--   Global clusters uses storage-based fast replication across regions
--   with latencies less than one second, using dedicated infrastructure
--   with no impact to your workload’s performance.
--   
--   You can create a global cluster that is initially empty, and then add
--   a primary and a secondary to it. Or you can specify an existing
--   cluster during the create operation, and this cluster becomes the
--   primary of the global cluster.
--   
--   This action only applies to Amazon DocumentDB clusters.
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.CreateGlobalCluster

-- | Represents the input to CreateGlobalCluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateGlobalCluster</a> smart constructor.
data CreateGlobalCluster
CreateGlobalCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> CreateGlobalCluster

-- | The engine version of the global cluster.
[$sel:engineVersion:CreateGlobalCluster'] :: CreateGlobalCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The deletion protection setting for the new global cluster. The global
--   cluster can't be deleted when deletion protection is enabled.
[$sel:deletionProtection:CreateGlobalCluster'] :: CreateGlobalCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The storage encryption setting for the new global cluster.
[$sel:storageEncrypted:CreateGlobalCluster'] :: CreateGlobalCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use as the primary cluster of the
--   global cluster. This parameter is optional.
[$sel:sourceDBClusterIdentifier:CreateGlobalCluster'] :: CreateGlobalCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
[$sel:engine:CreateGlobalCluster'] :: CreateGlobalCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The name for your database of up to 64 alpha-numeric characters. If
--   you do not provide a name, Amazon DocumentDB will not create a
--   database in the global cluster you are creating.
[$sel:databaseName:CreateGlobalCluster'] :: CreateGlobalCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster identifier of the new global cluster.
[$sel:globalClusterIdentifier:CreateGlobalCluster'] :: CreateGlobalCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateGlobalCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   global cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:CreateGlobalCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createGlobalCluster_deletionProtection</a> - The deletion
--   protection setting for the new global cluster. The global cluster
--   can't be deleted when deletion protection is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageEncrypted:CreateGlobalCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createGlobalCluster_storageEncrypted</a> - The storage encryption
--   setting for the new global cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDBClusterIdentifier:CreateGlobalCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createGlobalCluster_sourceDBClusterIdentifier</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) to use as the primary cluster of the global
--   cluster. This parameter is optional.
--

--   <a>createGlobalCluster_engine</a> - The name of the database engine to
--   be used for this cluster.

--   of up to 64 alpha-numeric characters. If you do not provide a name,
--   Amazon DocumentDB will not create a database in the global cluster you
--   are creating.
--

--   <a>createGlobalCluster_globalClusterIdentifier</a> - The cluster
--   identifier of the new global cluster.
