-- | Contains a user-provided database identifier. This identifier is the
--   unique key that identifies an instance.
dbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier
--   for the encrypted instance.
dbInstance_kmsKeyId :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are
--   created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the
--   <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
dbInstance_preferredBackupWindow :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the Availability Zone that the instance is
--   located in.
dbInstance_availabilityZone :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides a list of VPC security group elements that the instance
--   belongs to.
dbInstance_vpcSecurityGroups :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership])

-- | Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are
--   retained.
dbInstance_backupRetentionPeriod :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   instance, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
dbInstance_dbSubnetGroup :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe DBSubnetGroup)

-- | A list of log types that this instance is configured to export to
--   CloudWatch Logs.
dbInstance_enabledCloudwatchLogsExports :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the instance. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the instance is accessed.
dbInstance_dbiResourceId :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the connection endpoint.
dbInstance_endpoint :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Endpoint)

-- | Specifies the current state of this database.
dbInstance_dbInstanceStatus :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies that changes to the instance are pending. This element is
--   included only when changes are pending. Specific changes are
--   identified by subelements.
dbInstance_pendingModifiedValues :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe PendingModifiedValues)

-- | The status of a read replica. If the instance is not a read replica,
--   this is blank.
dbInstance_statusInfos :: Lens' DBInstance (Maybe [DBInstanceStatusInfo])

-- | Status of the instance. For a <tt>StatusType</tt> of read replica, the
--   values can be <tt>replicating</tt>, error, <tt>stopped</tt>, or
--   <tt>terminated</tt>.
dbInstanceStatusInfo_status :: Lens' DBInstanceStatusInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value that is <tt>true</tt> if the instance is operating
--   normally, or <tt>false</tt> if the instance is in an error state.
dbInstanceStatusInfo_normal :: Lens' DBInstanceStatusInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | This value is currently "<tt>read replication</tt>."
dbInstanceStatusInfo_statusType :: Lens' DBInstanceStatusInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Details of the error if there is an error for the instance. If the
--   instance is not in an error state, this value is blank.
dbInstanceStatusInfo_message :: Lens' DBInstanceStatusInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupName :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the virtual private cloud (VPC) ID of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_vpcId :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about one or more subnets within a subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_subnets :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe [Subnet])

-- | Provides the description of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupDescription :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_dbSubnetGroupArn :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the status of the subnet group.
dbSubnetGroup_subnetGroupStatus :: Lens' DBSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted
--   zone.
endpoint_hostedZoneId :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the DNS address of the instance.
endpoint_address :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.
endpoint_port :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the cluster parameter group family to return the engine
--   parameter information for.
engineDefaults_dbParameterGroupFamily :: Lens' EngineDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
engineDefaults_marker :: Lens' EngineDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | The parameters of a particular cluster parameter group family.
engineDefaults_parameters :: Lens' EngineDefaults (Maybe [Parameter])

-- | Specifies the source type for this event.
event_sourceType :: Lens' Event (Maybe SourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the event.
event_sourceArn :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the identifier for the source of the event.
event_sourceIdentifier :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the date and time of the event.
event_date :: Lens' Event (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the category for the event.
event_eventCategories :: Lens' Event (Maybe [Text])

-- | Provides the text of this event.
event_message :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The source type that the returned categories belong to.
eventCategoriesMap_sourceType :: Lens' EventCategoriesMap (Maybe Text)

-- | The event categories for the specified source type.
eventCategoriesMap_eventCategories :: Lens' EventCategoriesMap (Maybe [Text])

-- | The status of the Amazon DocumentDB event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   Can be one of the following: <tt>creating</tt>, <tt>modifying</tt>,
--   <tt>deleting</tt>, <tt>active</tt>, <tt>no-permission</tt>,
--   <tt>topic-not-exist</tt>
--   
--   The <tt>no-permission</tt> status indicates that Amazon DocumentDB no
--   longer has permission to post to the SNS topic. The
--   <tt>topic-not-exist</tt> status indicates that the topic was deleted
--   after the subscription was created.
eventSubscription_status :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services customer account that is associated with the
--   Amazon DocumentDB event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_customerAwsId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon DocumentDB event notification subscription ID.
eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The topic ARN of the Amazon DocumentDB event notification
--   subscription.
eventSubscription_snsTopicArn :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the event subscription.
eventSubscription_eventSubscriptionArn :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the subscription is enabled. A
--   value of <tt>true</tt> indicates that the subscription is enabled.
eventSubscription_enabled :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The source type for the Amazon DocumentDB event notification
--   subscription.
eventSubscription_sourceType :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The time at which the Amazon DocumentDB event notification
--   subscription was created.
eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of event categories for the Amazon DocumentDB event
--   notification subscription.
eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of source IDs for the Amazon DocumentDB event notification
--   subscription.
eventSubscription_sourceIdsList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the filter. Filter names are case sensitive.
filter_name :: Lens' Filter Text

-- | One or more filter values. Filter values are case sensitive.
filter_values :: Lens' Filter [Text]

-- | Indicates the database engine version.
globalCluster_engineVersion :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the current state of this global cluster.
globalCluster_status :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The deletion protection setting for the new global cluster.
globalCluster_deletionProtection :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The storage encryption setting for the global cluster.
globalCluster_storageEncrypted :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Contains a user-supplied global cluster identifier. This identifier is
--   the unique key that identifies a global cluster.
globalCluster_globalClusterIdentifier :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon DocumentDB database engine used by the global cluster.
globalCluster_engine :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the global cluster.
globalCluster_globalClusterArn :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The default database name within the new global cluster.
globalCluster_databaseName :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of cluster IDs for secondary clusters within the global
--   cluster. Currently limited to one item.
globalCluster_globalClusterMembers :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe [GlobalClusterMember])

-- | The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the global database
--   cluster. This identifier is found in AWS CloudTrail log entries
--   whenever the AWS KMS customer master key (CMK) for the cluster is
--   accessed.
globalCluster_globalClusterResourceId :: Lens' GlobalCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for each read-only secondary cluster
--   associated with the Aurora global cluster.
globalClusterMember_readers :: Lens' GlobalClusterMember (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for each Amazon DocumentDB cluster.
globalClusterMember_dbClusterArn :: Lens' GlobalClusterMember (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the Amazon DocumentDB cluster is the primary cluster
--   (that is, has read-write capability) for the Amazon DocumentDB global
--   cluster with which it is associated.
globalClusterMember_isWriter :: Lens' GlobalClusterMember (Maybe Bool)

-- | The engine version of an instance.
orderableDBInstanceOption_engineVersion :: Lens' OrderableDBInstanceOption (Maybe Text)

-- | The engine type of an instance.
orderableDBInstanceOption_engine :: Lens' OrderableDBInstanceOption (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance class for an instance.
orderableDBInstanceOption_dbInstanceClass :: Lens' OrderableDBInstanceOption (Maybe Text)

-- | The license model for an instance.
orderableDBInstanceOption_licenseModel :: Lens' OrderableDBInstanceOption (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of Availability Zones for an instance.
orderableDBInstanceOption_availabilityZones :: Lens' OrderableDBInstanceOption (Maybe [AvailabilityZone])

-- | Indicates whether an instance is in a virtual private cloud (VPC).
orderableDBInstanceOption_vpc :: Lens' OrderableDBInstanceOption (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the engine-specific parameters type.
parameter_applyType :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the value of the parameter.
parameter_parameterValue :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates when to apply parameter updates.
parameter_applyMethod :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe ApplyMethod)

-- | The earliest engine version to which the parameter can apply.
parameter_minimumEngineVersion :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the source of the parameter value.
parameter_source :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether (<tt>true</tt>) or not (<tt>false</tt>) the
--   parameter can be modified. Some parameters have security or
--   operational implications that prevent them from being changed.
parameter_isModifiable :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the valid data type for the parameter.
parameter_dataType :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the valid range of values for the parameter.
parameter_allowedValues :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the parameter.
parameter_parameterName :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides a description of the parameter.
parameter_description :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Log types that are in the process of being deactivated. After they are
--   deactivated, these log types aren't exported to CloudWatch Logs.
pendingCloudwatchLogsExports_logTypesToEnable :: Lens' PendingCloudwatchLogsExports (Maybe [Text])

-- | Log types that are in the process of being enabled. After they are
--   enabled, these log types are exported to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
pendingCloudwatchLogsExports_logTypesToDisable :: Lens' PendingCloudwatchLogsExports (Maybe [Text])

-- | The date of the maintenance window when the action is applied. The
--   maintenance action is applied to the resource during its first
--   maintenance window after this date. If this date is specified, any
--   <tt>next-maintenance</tt> opt-in requests are ignored.
pendingMaintenanceAction_autoAppliedAfterDate :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The type of pending maintenance action that is available for the
--   resource.
pendingMaintenanceAction_action :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the type of opt-in request that has been received for the
--   resource.
pendingMaintenanceAction_optInStatus :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | A description providing more detail about the maintenance action.
pendingMaintenanceAction_description :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the maintenance action is automatically applied. The
--   maintenance action is applied to the resource on this date regardless
--   of the maintenance window for the resource. If this date is specified,
--   any <tt>immediate</tt> opt-in requests are ignored.
pendingMaintenanceAction_forcedApplyDate :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The effective date when the pending maintenance action is applied to
--   the resource.
pendingMaintenanceAction_currentApplyDate :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates the database engine version.
pendingModifiedValues_engineVersion :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the pending or currently in-progress change of the master
--   credentials for the instance.
pendingModifiedValues_masterUserPassword :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The new subnet group for the instance.
pendingModifiedValues_dbSubnetGroupName :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the new Provisioned IOPS value for the instance that will be
--   applied or is currently being applied.
pendingModifiedValues_iops :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Int)

-- | Contains the new <tt>DBInstanceClass</tt> for the instance that will
--   be applied or is currently being applied.
pendingModifiedValues_dbInstanceClass :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The license model for the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>license-included</tt>,
--   <tt>bring-your-own-license</tt>, <tt>general-public-license</tt>
pendingModifiedValues_licenseModel :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the identifier of the certificate authority (CA) certificate
--   for the DB instance.
pendingModifiedValues_cACertificateIdentifier :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the new <tt>DBInstanceIdentifier</tt> for the instance that
--   will be applied or is currently being applied.
pendingModifiedValues_dbInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the log types whose configuration is still pending. These
--   log types are in the process of being activated or deactivated.
pendingModifiedValues_pendingCloudwatchLogsExports :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe PendingCloudwatchLogsExports)

-- | Specifies the pending number of days for which automated backups are
--   retained.
pendingModifiedValues_backupRetentionPeriod :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates that the Single-AZ instance is to change to a Multi-AZ
--   deployment.
pendingModifiedValues_multiAZ :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Bool)

-- | Contains the new <tt>AllocatedStorage</tt> size for then instance that
--   will be applied or is currently being applied.
pendingModifiedValues_allocatedStorage :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the pending port for the instance.
pendingModifiedValues_port :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the storage type to be associated with the instance.
pendingModifiedValues_storageType :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | A list that provides details about the pending maintenance actions for
--   the resource.
resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_pendingMaintenanceActionDetails :: Lens' ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions (Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that has pending
--   maintenance actions.
resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_resourceIdentifier :: Lens' ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the status of the subnet.
subnet_subnetStatus :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the identifier of the subnet.
subnet_subnetIdentifier :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the Availability Zone for the subnet.
subnet_subnetAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe AvailabilityZone)

-- | The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with
--   "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>". The string can contain only the
--   set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+',
--   '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with
--   "<tt>aws:</tt>" or "<tt>rds:</tt>". The string can contain only the
--   set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+',
--   '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number of the upgrade target database engine.
upgradeTarget_engineVersion :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether a database engine is upgraded to a
--   major version.
upgradeTarget_isMajorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the upgrade target database engine.
upgradeTarget_engine :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether the target version is applied to any
--   source DB instances that have <tt>AutoMinorVersionUpgrade</tt> set to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
upgradeTarget_autoUpgrade :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Bool)

-- | The version of the database engine that an instance can be upgraded
--   to.
upgradeTarget_description :: Lens' UpgradeTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the VPC security group.
vpcSecurityGroupMembership_status :: Lens' VpcSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the VPC security group.
vpcSecurityGroupMembership_vpcSecurityGroupId :: Lens' VpcSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)


module Network.AWS.DocumentDB.Waiters

-- | Polls <a>DescribeDBInstances</a> every 30 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed checks.
newDBInstanceAvailable :: Wait DescribeDBInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeDBInstances</a> every 30 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed checks.
newDBInstanceDeleted :: Wait DescribeDBInstances


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2014-10-31</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon DocumentDB API documentation
module Network.AWS.DocumentDB

-- | API version <tt>2014-10-31</tt> of the Amazon DocumentDB with MongoDB
--   compatibility SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The parameter group is in use, or it is in a state that is not valid.
--   If you are trying to delete the parameter group, you can't delete it
--   when the parameter group is in this state.
_InvalidDBParameterGroupStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested source could not be found.
_SourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>CertificateIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   certificate.
_CertificateNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You already have a cluster snapshot with the given identifier.
_DBClusterSnapshotAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A parameter group with the same name already exists.
_DBParameterGroupAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of parameter
--   groups.
_DBParameterGroupQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cluster doesn't have enough capacity for the current operation.
_InsufficientDBClusterCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided category does not exist.
_SubscriptionCategoryNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subscription name does not exist.
_SubscriptionNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested subnet is not valid, or multiple subnets were requested
--   that are not all in a common virtual private cloud (VPC).
_InvalidSubnet :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have exceeded the maximum number of accounts that you can share a
--   manual DB snapshot with.
_SharedSnapshotQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of subnets in
--   a subnet group.
_DBSubnetQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The <tt>GlobalClusterIdentifier</tt> already exists. Choose a new
--   global cluster identifier (unique name) to create a new global
--   cluster.
_GlobalClusterAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBClusterIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing cluster.
_DBClusterNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You already have a cluster with the given identifier.
_DBClusterAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Storage of the specified <tt>StorageType</tt> can't be associated with
--   the DB instance.
_StorageTypeNotSupportedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The SNS topic Amazon Resource Name (ARN) does not exist.
_SNSTopicArnNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Someone else might be modifying a subscription. Wait a few seconds,
--   and try again.
_InvalidEventSubscriptionStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error occurred when accessing an KMS key.
_KMSKeyNotAccessibleFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSnapshotIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing snapshot.
_DBSnapshotNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBClusterParameterGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   cluster parameter group.
_DBClusterParameterGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cluster can't be created because you have reached the maximum
--   allowed quota of clusters.
_DBClusterQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of snapshots.
_SnapshotQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSubnetGroupName</tt> is already being used by an existing subnet
--   group.
_DBSubnetGroupAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You do not have permission to publish to the SNS topic Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN).
_SNSNoAuthorizationFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSecurityGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing security
--   group.
_DBSecurityGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of instances.
_InstanceQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBParameterGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing parameter
--   group.
_DBParameterGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet isn't in the <i>available</i> state.
_InvalidDBSubnetStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   cluster snapshot.
_DBClusterSnapshotNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Amazon SNS has responded that there is a problem with the specified
--   topic.
_SNSInvalidTopicFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified instance class isn't available in the specified
--   Availability Zone.
_InsufficientDBInstanceCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided value isn't a valid cluster snapshot state.
_InvalidDBClusterSnapshotStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided subscription name already exists.
_SubscriptionAlreadyExistFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet group doesn't cover all Availability Zones after it is
--   created because of changes that were made.
_InvalidVPCNetworkStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified CIDR IP or Amazon EC2 security group isn't authorized
--   for the specified security group.
--   
--   Amazon DocumentDB also might not be authorized to perform necessary
--   actions on your behalf using IAM.
_AuthorizationNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed number of subnet
--   groups.
_DBSubnetGroupQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested operation can't be performed while the cluster is in
--   this state.
_InvalidGlobalClusterStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have reached the maximum number of event subscriptions.
_EventSubscriptionQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There is not enough storage available for the current action. You
--   might be able to resolve this error by updating your subnet group to
--   use different Availability Zones that have more storage available.
_InsufficientStorageClusterCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cluster isn't in a valid state.
_InvalidDBClusterStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The <tt>GlobalClusterIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing
--   global cluster.
_GlobalClusterNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You already have a instance with the given identifier.
_DBInstanceAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You cannot restore from a virtual private cloud (VPC) backup to a
--   non-VPC DB instance.
_InvalidRestoreFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The state of the security group doesn't allow deletion.
_InvalidDBSecurityGroupStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource ID was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSubnetGroupName</tt> doesn't refer to an existing subnet group.
_DBSubnetGroupNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The upgrade failed because a resource that the depends on can't be
--   modified.
_DBUpgradeDependencyFailureFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified instance isn't in the <i>available</i> state.
_InvalidDBInstanceStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBSnapshotIdentifier</tt> is already being used by an existing
--   snapshot.
_DBSnapshotAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <tt>DBInstanceIdentifier</tt> doesn't refer to an existing instance.
_DBInstanceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause you to exceed the allowed amount of storage
--   available across all instances.
_StorageQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The state of the snapshot doesn't allow deletion.
_InvalidDBSnapshotStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet group can't be deleted because it's in use.
_InvalidDBSubnetGroupStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The number of global clusters for this account is already at the
--   maximum allowed.
_GlobalClusterQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Subnets in the subnet group should cover at least two Availability
--   Zones unless there is only one Availability Zone.
_DBSubnetGroupDoesNotCoverEnoughAZs :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet is already in use in the Availability Zone.
_SubnetAlreadyInUse :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Polls <a>DescribeDBInstances</a> every 30 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed checks.
newDBInstanceAvailable :: Wait DescribeDBInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeDBInstances</a> every 30 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed checks.
newDBInstanceDeleted :: Wait DescribeDBInstances

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyDBInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> - This parameter does
--   not apply to Amazon DocumentDB. Amazon DocumentDB does not perform
--   minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newDBInstanceIdentifier':ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_newDBInstanceIdentifier</a> - The new instance
--   identifier for the instance when renaming an instance. When you change
--   the instance identifier, an instance reboot occurs immediately if you
--   set <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. It occurs during the
--   next maintenance window if you set <tt>Apply Immediately</tt> to
--   <tt>false</tt>. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>mydbinstance</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceClass:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_dbInstanceClass</a> - The new compute and memory
--   capacity of the instance; for example, <tt>db.r5.large</tt>. Not all
--   instance classes are available in all Regions.
--   
--   If you modify the instance class, an outage occurs during the change.
--   The change is applied during the next maintenance window, unless
--   <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> is specified as <tt>true</tt> for this
--   request.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:promotionTier:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_promotionTier</a> - A value that specifies the
--   order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary
--   instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Valid values: 0-15
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The weekly time
--   range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur, which might
--   result in an outage. Changing this parameter doesn't result in an
--   outage except in the following situation, and the change is
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If there are pending
--   actions that cause a reboot, and the maintenance window is changed to
--   include the current time, changing this parameter causes a reboot of
--   the instance. If you are moving this window to the current time, there
--   must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and end of the
--   window to ensure that pending changes are applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cACertificateIdentifier:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_cACertificateIdentifier</a> - Indicates the
--   certificate that needs to be associated with the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_applyImmediately</a> - Specifies whether the
--   modifications in this request and any pending modifications are
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible, regardless of the
--   <tt>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> setting for the instance.
--   
--   If this parameter is set to <tt>false</tt>, changes to the instance
--   are applied during the next maintenance window. Some parameter changes
--   can cause an outage and are applied on the next reboot.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:ModifyDBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier</a> - The instance
--   identifier. This value is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBInstance</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
newModifyDBInstance :: Text -> ModifyDBInstance

data DescribeEvents

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEvents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:DescribeEvents'</a>, <a>describeEvents_startTime</a>
--   - The beginning of the time interval to retrieve events for, specified
--   in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   Example: 2009-07-08T18:00Z
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:DescribeEvents'</a>,
--   <a>describeEvents_sourceType</a> - The event source to retrieve events
--   for. If no value is specified, all events are returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeEvents'</a>, <a>describeEvents_filters</a> -
--   This parameter is not currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdentifier:DescribeEvents'</a>,
--   <a>describeEvents_sourceIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the event
--   source for which events are returned. If not specified, then all
--   sources are included in the response.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If <tt>SourceIdentifier</tt> is provided, <tt>SourceType</tt> must
--   also be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBInstance</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBInstanceIdentifier</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBSecurityGroup</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBSecurityGroupName</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBParameterGroup</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBParameterGroupName</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is <tt>DBSnapshot</tt>, a
--   <tt>DBSnapshotIdentifier</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:DescribeEvents'</a>,

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CreateEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>createEventSubscription_enabled</a> - A Boolean value; set to
--   <tt>true</tt> to activate the subscription, set to <tt>false</tt> to
--   create the subscription but not active it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:CreateEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>createEventSubscription_sourceType</a> - The type of source that is
--   generating the events. For example, if you want to be notified of
--   events generated by an instance, you would set this parameter to
--   <tt>db-instance</tt>. If this value is not specified, all events are
--   returned.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>db-instance</tt>, <tt>db-cluster</tt>,
--   <tt>db-parameter-group</tt>, <tt>db-security-group</tt>,
--   <tt>db-cluster-snapshot</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:CreateEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>createEventSubscription_eventCategories</a> - A list of event
--   categories for a <tt>SourceType</tt> that you want to subscribe to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIds:CreateEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>createEventSubscription_sourceIds</a> - The list of identifiers of
--   the event sources for which events are returned. If not specified,
--   then all sources are included in the response. An identifier must
--   begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and
--   hyphens; it can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive
--   hyphens.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If <tt>SourceIds</tt> are provided, <tt>SourceType</tt> must also
--   be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is an instance, a <tt>DBInstanceIdentifier</tt>
--   must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is a security group, a
--   <tt>DBSecurityGroupName</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is a parameter group, a
--   <tt>DBParameterGroupName</tt> must be provided.</li>
--   <li>If the source type is a snapshot, a <tt>DBSnapshotIdentifier</tt>
--   must be provided.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>createEventSubscription_tags</a> - The tags to be assigned to the
--   event subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionName:CreateEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>createEventSubscription_subscriptionName</a> - The name of the
--   subscription.
--   
--   Constraints: The name must be fewer than 255 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:CreateEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>createEventSubscription_snsTopicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the SNS topic created for event notification. Amazon SNS
--   creates the ARN when you create a topic and subscribe to it.
newCreateEventSubscription :: Text -> Text -> CreateEventSubscription

--   minor version upgrades regardless of the value set.

--   instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.

--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour

--   Region.
--   
--   Example: <tt>us-east-1d</tt>

--   tags to be assigned to the instance. You can assign up to 10 tags to
--   an instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:CreateDBInstance'</a>,

--   identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>

--   to use when restoring an encrypted cluster from a DB snapshot or
--   cluster snapshot.
--   
--   The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS
--   encryption key. If you are restoring a cluster with the same account
--   that owns the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the new cluster, then
--   you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS
--   encryption key.
--

--   then the following occurs:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the snapshot or cluster snapshot in <tt>SnapshotIdentifier</tt>
--   is encrypted, then the restored cluster is encrypted using the KMS key
--   that was used to encrypt the snapshot or the cluster snapshot.</li>

--   <tt>SnapshotIdentifier</tt> is not encrypted, then the restored DB
--   cluster is not encrypted.</li>
--   </ul>

--

--   cluster snapshot, set this value to <tt>restore</tt>.

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyDBCluster</a> with all optional fields

--   is not supported on Amazon DocumentDB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_deletionProtection</a> - Specifies whether this
--   cluster can be deleted. If <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the
--   cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled. <tt>DeletionProtection</tt>
--   protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUserPassword:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_masterUserPassword</a> - The password for the
--   master database user. This password can contain any printable ASCII
--   character except forward slash (/), double quote ("), or the "at"
--   symbol (@).
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 100 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_cloudwatchLogsExportConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration setting for the log types to be enabled for export to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs for a specific instance or cluster. The
--   <tt>EnableLogTypes</tt> and <tt>DisableLogTypes</tt> arrays determine
--   which logs are exported (or not exported) to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The weekly time
--   range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region, occurring on a random day of the week.
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_preferredBackupWindow</a> - The daily time range
--   during which automated backups are created if automated backups are
--   enabled, using the <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt> parameter.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the format <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Must be in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_backupRetentionPeriod</a> - The number of days for
--   which automated backups are retained. You must specify a minimum value
--   of 1.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be a value from 1 to 35.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_vpcSecurityGroupIds</a> - A list of virtual private
--   cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster will belong to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterParameterGroupName:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_dbClusterParameterGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   cluster parameter group to use for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_applyImmediately</a> - A value that specifies
--   whether the changes in this request and any pending changes are
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible, regardless of the
--   <tt>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> setting for the cluster. If this
--   parameter is set to <tt>false</tt>, changes to the cluster are applied
--   during the next maintenance window.
--   
--   The <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> parameter affects only the
--   <tt>NewDBClusterIdentifier</tt> and <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt>
--   values. If you set this parameter value to <tt>false</tt>, the changes
--   to the <tt>NewDBClusterIdentifier</tt> and <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt>
--   values are applied during the next maintenance window. All other
--   changes are applied immediately, regardless of the value of the
--   <tt>ApplyImmediately</tt> parameter.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:newDBClusterIdentifier':ModifyDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyDBCluster_newDBClusterIdentifier</a> - The new cluster
--   identifier for the cluster when renaming a cluster. This value is
--   stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-cluster2</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:ModifyDBCluster'</a>, <a>modifyDBCluster_port</a> - The
--   port number on which the cluster accepts connections.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be a value from <tt>1150</tt> to <tt>65535</tt>.
--   
--   Default: The same port as the original cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:ModifyDBCluster'</a>,

--   for the cluster that is being modified. This parameter is not case
--   sensitive.
--

--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>

--

--   <li>Must specify a valid cluster parameter group.</li>
--   <li>If the source cluster parameter group is in the same Region as the

--

--   <li>Cannot be null, empty, or blank.</li>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 255 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>

data CopyDBClusterSnapshot
CopyDBClusterSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CopyDBClusterSnapshot

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyDBClusterSnapshot</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:preSignedUrl:CopyDBClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copyDBClusterSnapshot_preSignedUrl</a> - The URL that contains a
--   Signature Version 4 signed request for
--   the<tt>CopyDBClusterSnapshot</tt> API action in the Region that
--   contains the source cluster snapshot to copy. You must use the
--   <tt>PreSignedUrl</tt> parameter when copying a cluster snapshot from
--   another Region.
--   
--   If you are using an Amazon Web Services SDK tool or the CLI, you can
--   specify <tt>SourceRegion</tt> (or <tt>--source-region</tt> for the
--   CLI) instead of specifying <tt>PreSignedUrl</tt> manually. Specifying
--   <tt>SourceRegion</tt> autogenerates a pre-signed URL that is a valid
--   request for the operation that can be executed in the source Region.
--   
--   The presigned URL must be a valid request for the
--   <tt>CopyDBClusterSnapshot</tt> API action that can be executed in the
--   source Region that contains the cluster snapshot to be copied. The
--   presigned URL request must contain the following parameter values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SourceRegion</tt> - The ID of the region that contains the
--   snapshot to be copied.</li>
--   <li><tt>SourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> - The identifier for
--   the the encrypted cluster snapshot to be copied. This identifier must
--   be in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format for the source Region. For
--   example, if you are copying an encrypted cluster snapshot from the
--   us-east-1 Region, then your <tt>SourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt>
--   looks something like the following:
--   <tt>arn:aws:rds:us-east-1:12345678012:sample-cluster:sample-cluster-snapshot</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>TargetDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> - The identifier for
--   the new cluster snapshot to be created. This parameter isn't case
--   sensitive.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyTags:CopyDBClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copyDBClusterSnapshot_copyTags</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to copy
--   all tags from the source cluster snapshot to the target cluster
--   snapshot, and otherwise <tt>false</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:CopyDBClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copyDBClusterSnapshot_kmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key ID for an
--   encrypted cluster snapshot. The KMS key ID is the Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN), KMS key identifier, or the KMS key alias for the KMS encryption
--   key.
--   
--   If you copy an encrypted cluster snapshot from your account, you can
--   specify a value for <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> to encrypt the copy with a new
--   KMS encryption key. If you don't specify a value for
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>, then the copy of the cluster snapshot is encrypted
--   with the same KMS key as the source cluster snapshot.
--   
--   If you copy an encrypted cluster snapshot that is shared from another
--   account, then you must specify a value for <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>.
--   
--   To copy an encrypted cluster snapshot to another Region, set
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> to the KMS key ID that you want to use to encrypt
--   the copy of the cluster snapshot in the destination Region. KMS
--   encryption keys are specific to the Region that they are created in,
--   and you can't use encryption keys from one Region in another Region.
--   
--   If you copy an unencrypted cluster snapshot and specify a value for
--   the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, an error is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CopyDBClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copyDBClusterSnapshot_tags</a> - The tags to be assigned to the
--   cluster snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier:CopyDBClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copyDBClusterSnapshot_sourceDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</a> - The
--   identifier of the cluster snapshot to copy. This parameter is not case
--   sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must specify a valid system snapshot in the <i>available</i>
--   state.</li>
--   <li>If the source snapshot is in the same Region as the copy, specify
--   a valid snapshot identifier.</li>
--   <li>If the source snapshot is in a different Region than the copy,
--   specify a valid cluster snapshot ARN.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-cluster-snapshot1</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier:CopyDBClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copyDBClusterSnapshot_targetDBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</a> - The
--   identifier of the new cluster snapshot to create from the source
--   cluster snapshot. This parameter is not case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-cluster-snapshot2</tt>
newCopyDBClusterSnapshot :: Text -> Text -> CopyDBClusterSnapshot

--   the latest major engine version. For production workloads, we
--   recommend explicitly declaring this parameter with the intended major
--   engine version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_deletionProtection</a> - Specifies whether this
--   cluster can be deleted. If <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the
--   cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled. <tt>DeletionProtection</tt>
--   protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageEncrypted:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_storageEncrypted</a> - Specifies whether the
--   cluster is encrypted.

--   <a>createDBCluster_masterUserPassword</a> - The password for the
--   master database user. This password can contain any printable ASCII
--   character except forward slash (/), double quote ("), or the "at"
--   symbol (@).
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 100 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:globalClusterIdentifier:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_globalClusterIdentifier</a> - The cluster
--   identifier of the new global cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUsername:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_masterUsername</a> - The name of the master user
--   for the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be from 1 to 63 letters or numbers.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot be a reserved word for the chosen database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroupName:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_dbSubnetGroupName</a> - A subnet group to associate
--   with this cluster.
--   
--   Constraints: Must match the name of an existing
--   <tt>DBSubnetGroup</tt>. Must not be default.
--   
--   Example: <tt>mySubnetgroup</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:preSignedUrl:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_preSignedUrl</a> - Not currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The weekly time
--   range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region, occurring on a random day of the week.
--   
--   Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_availabilityZones</a> - A list of Amazon EC2
--   Availability Zones that instances in the cluster can be created in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:CreateDBCluster'</a>, <a>createDBCluster_kmsKeyId</a>
--   - The KMS key identifier for an encrypted cluster.
--   
--   The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS
--   encryption key. If you are creating a cluster using the same account
--   that owns the KMS encryption key that is used to encrypt the new
--   cluster, you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS
--   encryption key.
--   
--   If an encryption key is not specified in <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> parameter is <tt>true</tt>,
--   Amazon DocumentDB uses your default encryption key.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your account. Your account
--   has a different default encryption key for each Regions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_preferredBackupWindow</a> - The daily time range
--   during which automated backups are created if automated backups are
--   enabled using the <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt> parameter.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each Region.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the format <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Must be in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_backupRetentionPeriod</a> - The number of days for
--   which automated backups are retained. You must specify a minimum value
--   of 1.
--   
--   Default: 1
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be a value from 1 to 35.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_vpcSecurityGroupIds</a> - A list of EC2 VPC
--   security groups to associate with this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterParameterGroupName:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_dbClusterParameterGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   cluster parameter group to associate with this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateDBCluster'</a>, <a>createDBCluster_tags</a> - The
--   tags to be assigned to the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:CreateDBCluster'</a>, <a>createDBCluster_port</a> - The
--   port number on which the instances in the cluster accept connections.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableCloudwatchLogsExports:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_enableCloudwatchLogsExports</a> - A list of log
--   types that need to be enabled for exporting to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   You can enable audit logs or profiler logs. For more information, see
--   <a>Auditing Amazon DocumentDB Events</a> and <a>Profiling Amazon
--   DocumentDB Operations</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:CreateDBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createDBCluster_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - The cluster identifier.
--   This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-cluster</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:CreateDBCluster'</a>, <a>createDBCluster_engine</a> -
--   The name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>docdb</tt>
newCreateDBCluster :: Text -> Text -> CreateDBCluster

data DescribeDBClusterSnapshots
DescribeDBClusterSnapshots' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> DescribeDBClusterSnapshots

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDBClusterSnapshots</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - The ID of the
--   cluster to retrieve the list of cluster snapshots for. This parameter
--   can't be used with the <tt>DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier</tt> parameter.
--   This parameter is not case sensitive.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeShared:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_includeShared</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt>
--   to include shared manual cluster snapshots from other accounts that
--   this account has been given permission to copy or restore, and
--   otherwise <tt>false</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterSnapshotIdentifier:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_dbClusterSnapshotIdentifier</a> - A
--   specific cluster snapshot identifier to describe. This parameter can't
--   be used with the <tt>DBClusterIdentifier</tt> parameter. This value is
--   stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If provided, must match the identifier of an existing
--   <tt>DBClusterSnapshot</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If this identifier is for an automated snapshot, the
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> parameter must also be specified.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_filters</a> - This parameter is not
--   currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotType:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_snapshotType</a> - The type of cluster
--   snapshots to be returned. You can specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>automated</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that Amazon
--   DocumentDB has automatically created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>manual</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that you have
--   manually created for your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>shared</tt> - Return all manual cluster snapshots that have
--   been shared to your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Return all cluster snapshots that have been
--   marked as public.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify a <tt>SnapshotType</tt> value, then both
--   automated and manual cluster snapshots are returned. You can include
--   shared cluster snapshots with these results by setting the
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>. You can include
--   public cluster snapshots with these results by setting
--   the<tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>IncludeShared</tt> and <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameters don't
--   apply for <tt>SnapshotType</tt> values of <tt>manual</tt> or
--   <tt>automated</tt>. The <tt>IncludePublic</tt> parameter doesn't apply
--   when <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>shared</tt>. The
--   <tt>IncludeShared</tt> parameter doesn't apply when
--   <tt>SnapshotType</tt> is set to <tt>public</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_marker</a> - An optional pagination
--   token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified,
--   the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRecords:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_maxRecords</a> - The maximum number of
--   records to include in the response. If more records exist than the
--   specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token (marker) is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includePublic:DescribeDBClusterSnapshots'</a>,
--   <a>describeDBClusterSnapshots_includePublic</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt>
--   to include manual cluster snapshots that are public and can be copied
--   or restored by any account, and otherwise <tt>false</tt>. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
newDescribeDBClusterSnapshots :: DescribeDBClusterSnapshots

-- | Represents the input to RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreDBClusterToPointInTime</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime
RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_deletionProtection</a> - Specifies
--   whether this cluster can be deleted. If <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is
--   enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled. <tt>DeletionProtection</tt>
--   protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useLatestRestorableTime:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_useLatestRestorableTime</a> - A value
--   that is set to <tt>true</tt> to restore the cluster to the latest
--   restorable backup time, and <tt>false</tt> otherwise.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Constraints: Cannot be specified if the <tt>RestoreToTime</tt>
--   parameter is provided.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroupName:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_dbSubnetGroupName</a> - The subnet
--   group name to use for the new cluster.
--   
--   Constraints: If provided, must match the name of an existing
--   <tt>DBSubnetGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Example: <tt>mySubnetgroup</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_kmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key identifier
--   to use when restoring an encrypted cluster from an encrypted cluster.
--   
--   The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS
--   encryption key. If you are restoring a cluster with the same account
--   that owns the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the new cluster, then
--   you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS
--   encryption key.
--   
--   You can restore to a new cluster and encrypt the new cluster with an
--   KMS key that is different from the KMS key used to encrypt the source
--   cluster. The new DB cluster is encrypted with the KMS key identified
--   by the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter,
--   then the following occurs:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the cluster is encrypted, then the restored cluster is
--   encrypted using the KMS key that was used to encrypt the source
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li>If the cluster is not encrypted, then the restored cluster is not
--   encrypted.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <tt>DBClusterIdentifier</tt> refers to a cluster that is not
--   encrypted, then the restore request is rejected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_vpcSecurityGroupIds</a> - A list of
--   VPC security groups that the new cluster belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restoreToTime:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_restoreToTime</a> - The date and time
--   to restore the cluster to.
--   
--   Valid values: A time in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) format.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be before the latest restorable time for the instance.</li>
--   <li>Must be specified if the <tt>UseLatestRestorableTime</tt>
--   parameter is not provided.</li>
--   <li>Cannot be specified if the <tt>UseLatestRestorableTime</tt>
--   parameter is <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Cannot be specified if the <tt>RestoreType</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>copy-on-write</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>2015-03-07T23:45:00Z</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_tags</a> - The tags to be assigned to
--   the restored cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_port</a> - The port number on which
--   the new cluster accepts connections.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be a value from <tt>1150</tt> to <tt>65535</tt>.
--   
--   Default: The default port for the engine.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableCloudwatchLogsExports:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_enableCloudwatchLogsExports</a> - A
--   list of log types that must be enabled for exporting to Amazon
--   CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - The name of
--   the new cluster to be created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDBClusterIdentifier:RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime'</a>,
--   <a>restoreDBClusterToPointInTime_sourceDBClusterIdentifier</a> - The
--   identifier of the source cluster from which to restore.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must match the identifier of an existing <tt>DBCluster</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
newRestoreDBClusterToPointInTime :: Text -> Text -> RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBCluster</a> smart constructor.
data DBCluster
DBCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DBClusterMember] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DBClusterRole] -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DBCluster

-- | Create a value of <a>DBCluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_engineVersion</a> -
--   Indicates the database engine version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_status</a> - Specifies the
--   current state of this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_deletionProtection</a> - Specifies whether this cluster
--   can be deleted. If <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is enabled, the cluster
--   cannot be deleted unless it is modified and
--   <tt>DeletionProtection</tt> is disabled. <tt>DeletionProtection</tt>
--   protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageEncrypted:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_storageEncrypted</a> - Specifies whether the cluster is
--   encrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterIdentifier:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - Contains a user-supplied
--   cluster identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies
--   a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterMembers:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterMembers</a> - Provides the list of instances
--   that make up the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readReplicaIdentifiers:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_readReplicaIdentifiers</a> - Contains one or more
--   identifiers of the secondary clusters that are associated with this
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationSourceIdentifier:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_replicationSourceIdentifier</a> - Contains the identifier
--   of the source cluster if this cluster is a secondary cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostedZoneId:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_hostedZoneId</a> -
--   Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted
--   zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterParameterGroup:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterParameterGroup</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   cluster parameter group for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUsername:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_masterUsername</a>
--   - Contains the master user name for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterResourceId:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_dbClusterResourceId</a> - The Region-unique, immutable
--   identifier for the cluster. This identifier is found in CloudTrail log
--   entries whenever the KMS key for the cluster is accessed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:earliestRestorableTime:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_earliestRestorableTime</a> - The earliest time to which a
--   database can be restored with point-in-time restore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_engine</a> - Provides the
--   name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbClusterArn:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_dbClusterArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestRestorableTime:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_latestRestorableTime</a> - Specifies the latest time to
--   which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - Specifies the weekly
--   time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_availabilityZones</a> - Provides the list of Amazon EC2
--   Availability Zones that instances in the cluster can be created in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_kmsKeyId</a> - If
--   <tt>StorageEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, the KMS key identifier for
--   the encrypted cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_preferredBackupWindow</a> - Specifies the daily time
--   range during which automated backups are created if automated backups
--   are enabled, as determined by the <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associatedRoles:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_associatedRoles</a> - Provides a list of the Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) roles that are associated with the cluster.
--   (IAM) roles that are associated with a cluster grant permission for
--   the cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services on your
--   behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_vpcSecurityGroups</a> - Provides a list of virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_backupRetentionPeriod</a> - Specifies the number of days
--   for which automatic snapshots are retained.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbSubnetGroup:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_dbSubnetGroup</a> -
--   Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the
--   cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiAZ:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_multiAZ</a> - Specifies
--   whether the cluster has instances in multiple Availability Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabledCloudwatchLogsExports:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_enabledCloudwatchLogsExports</a> - A list of log types
--   that this cluster is configured to export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCreateTime:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_clusterCreateTime</a> - Specifies the time when the
--   cluster was created, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_endpoint</a> - Specifies
--   the connection endpoint for the primary instance of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentProgress:DBCluster'</a>,
--   <a>dbCluster_percentProgress</a> - Specifies the progress of the
--   operation as a percentage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readerEndpoint:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_readerEndpoint</a>
--   - The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a
--   cluster load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB
--   replicas that are available in a cluster. As clients request new
--   connections to the reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the
--   connection requests among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the
--   cluster. This functionality can help balance your read workload across
--   multiple Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.
--   
--   If a failover occurs, and the Amazon DocumentDB replica that you are
--   connected to is promoted to be the primary instance, your connection
--   is dropped. To continue sending your read workload to other Amazon
--   DocumentDB replicas in the cluster, you can then reconnect to the
--   reader endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:DBCluster'</a>, <a>dbCluster_port</a> - Specifies the
--   port that the database engine is listening on.
newDBCluster :: DBCluster

--   Describes the state of association between the IAMrole and the
--   cluster. The <tt>Status</tt> property returns one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVE</tt> - The IAMrole ARN is associated with the cluster
--   and can be used to access other Amazon Web Services services on your
--   behalf.</li>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The IAMrole ARN is being associated with the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>INVALID</tt> - The IAMrole ARN is associated with the cluster,
--   but the cluster cannot assume the IAMrole to access other Amazon Web
--   Services services on your behalf.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DBClusterRole'</a>, <a>dbClusterRole_roleArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAMrole that is associated with the
--   DB cluster.
newDBClusterRole :: DBClusterRole

newDBClusterSnapshot :: DBClusterSnapshot

-- | Contains the name and values of a manual cluster snapshot attribute.
--   
--   Manual cluster snapshot attributes are used to authorize other
--   accounts to restore a manual cluster snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDBClusterSnapshotAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data DBClusterSnapshotAttribute
DBClusterSnapshotAttribute' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> DBClusterSnapshotAttribute

-- | Create a value of <a>DBClusterSnapshotAttribute</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeValues:DBClusterSnapshotAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>dbClusterSnapshotAttribute_attributeValues</a> - The values for the
--   manual cluster snapshot attribute.
--   
--   If the <tt>AttributeName</tt> field is set to <tt>restore</tt>, then
--   this element returns a list of IDs of the accounts that are authorized
--   to copy or restore the manual cluster snapshot. If a value of
--   <tt>all</tt> is in the list, then the manual cluster snapshot is
--   public and available for any account to copy or restore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:DBClusterSnapshotAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>dbClusterSnapshotAttribute_attributeName</a> - The name of the
--   manual cluster snapshot attribute.
--   
--   The attribute named <tt>restore</tt> refers to the list of accounts
--   that have permission to copy or restore the manual cluster snapshot.
newDBClusterSnapshotAttribute :: DBClusterSnapshotAttribute

--   <a>dbInstance_storageEncrypted</a> - Specifies whether or not the
--   instance is encrypted.

--   <a>dbInstance_dbClusterIdentifier</a> - Contains the name of the
--   cluster that the instance is a member of if the instance is a member
--   of a cluster.

--   <a>dbInstance_publiclyAccessible</a> - Not supported. Amazon
--   DocumentDB does not currently support public endpoints. The value of
--   <tt>PubliclyAccessible</tt> is always <tt>false</tt>.

--   an instance.

--   range during which automated backups are created if automated backups
--   are enabled, as determined by the <tt>BackupRetentionPeriod</tt>.

--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPeriod:DBInstance'</a>,
--   <a>dbInstance_backupRetentionPeriod</a> - Specifies the number of days
--   for which automatic snapshots are retained.
--

--   - The Region-unique, immutable identifier for the instance. This
--   identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for
--   the instance is accessed.
--
